headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Ladies and gentlemen, thank you for standing by. Welcome to the HARMAN Fiscal 2016 Second Quarter Earnings Call. [Operator Instructions] As a reminder, this conference is being recorded Thursday, January 28, 2016. I would now like to turn the conference o
componenttext: Ladies and gentlemen, thank you for standing by. Welcome to the HARMAN Fiscal 2016 Second Quarter Earnings Call. [Operator Instructions] As a reminder, this conference is being recorded Thursday, January 28, 2016. I would now like to turn the conference over to Yijing Brentano, Vice President of Strategy and Investor Relations. Please go ahead.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Dimitri, and thank you for joining our second quarter fiscal year 2016 investor call. I'm joined in Stanford today by Dinesh Paliwal, our Chairman, and President and Chief Executive Officer; and by Sandy Rowland, our Chief Financial Officer. If yo
componenttext:
Thanks, Dimitri, and thank you for joining our second quarter fiscal year 2016 investor call. I'm joined in Stanford today by Dinesh Paliwal, our Chairman, and President and Chief Executive Officer; and by Sandy Rowland, our Chief Financial Officer. If you haven't done so already, I invite you to visit our newly redesigned Investors section of our website, where you can download copies of our earnings release and the supporting slide presentation that we will be referencing today. Before Dinesh and Sandy provide their remarks on the quarter, let me remind you that certain statements during this conference call and question-and-answer session may be forward-looking in nature as defined in the United States Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. These forward-looking statements are based on management's beliefs, assumptions and current expectations, but are subject to a number of important risk factors and uncertainties, which have been fully described in the press release that we issued this morning. 
Now let me turn the call over to Dinesh.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Yijing, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. I'm very pleased to report that earlier this morning, we released solid results for the second quarter. Excluding the impact of foreign exchange, net sales increased 19% to $1.8 billion, our perfo
componenttext:
Thank you, Yijing, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. I'm very pleased to report that earlier this morning, we released solid results for the second quarter. Excluding the impact of foreign exchange, net sales increased 19% to $1.8 billion, our performance on the top line again resulted in double-digit EBITDA growth. We expanded our operating margins and generated $225 million in EBITDA and reported earnings per share of $1.84. On a constant-currency basis, EBITDA was up 20%, and earnings per share was up 9% compared to the prior year. This is now our 11th consecutive quarter of top and bottom line growth. 
Let me give you some additional color specifically on Connected Car division. Q1 came in 19% top line on constant currency; Q2, 9%; first half, 14%. You may recall we guided you for 13% on constant currency, and we are up already ahead of our guidance, and we feel pretty good about our second half. If [indiscernible] gets validated, in fiscal '15, you may recall, we booked $6.2 billion worth of automotive orders, year-to-date we booked $2 billion, that is $8.2 billion of orders in the last 18 months. We never had any momentum like that, and I don't think anybody else had in the industry. [indiscernible] rates are expanding, continue to expand and to expedite nonlinear [indiscernible] extension, which we all are hoping and waiting to see soon. We have done some big moves transformation. We acquired [indiscernible] for end to end connectivity services in the car, we acquired Redbend, we acquired [indiscernible] for cybersecurity because of there is no autonomous Connected Car without cybersecurity, you should be asking that question to other people. No one is thinking about it, but we got a strong confidence from our automakers at TS and had it validated and we have tremendous enthusiasm. So I don't know what market, I'm feeling damn good. 
So with that, let me just go on to talk about our other divisions. In our consumer business, we have a very strong holiday season as a result of the growing consumer demand for our family of portable speakers, including the recently launched JBL Xtreme, JBL Flip 3, JBL, our expanded global distribution channels together with prime shelf space and marketing initiatives after huge evidence. In addition, our partnership with media market in Germany and connect in France delivered very strong sales growth. You may recall we became the leading audio partner in media stores a year ago. In the automotive business OEMs side separate investing in connected and autonomous car technology along with smart audio solutions. We are well-positioned to capitalize on this demand, peak rates for Connected Car and car audio solutions continue to rise. At the end of fiscal '15 we have an industry-leading backlog of $23 billion. Since then, we have secured another $2 billion of new automotive awards year-to-date, and as I remind, this is a double-digit operating margin business. 
So before I dive into the details of the division, let me recap some of the headlines we made at CES earlier this month. As some of you know firsthand, our exhibit hall was packed, and this is a high quality audience strictly by invitation only with our current and potential customers. The entire [indiscernible] of the show. It was great seeing so many of you at the investor event. HARMAN's innovations were standout, earning a company-best and industry-best [indiscernible] CES Innovation awards, America's Choice Award for our new cobranded JBL Under Armour headphone which I'll talk about in a minute and a Best of CES Award for voice audio. HARMAN is partnering with the most innovative companies in the world. Our announcements with Google, Microsoft and Under Armour gained broad attention, and I'll go into details in a second. We also demonstrated HARMAN's newest technology for the connected and intelligent car, like enhancing intelligent [indiscernible] solution. We call it lists, and IBS. HARMAN had integrated the industry's most complete end-to-end system to provide drivers intelligent, adaptable and personalized solution in the car. We have built a suite of integrated technologies encompassing not only infotainment which includes navigation, multimedia and radio and television tuners to now include telematics, safety and cybersecurity features on one complete platform. This complete platform is scalable and modular to allow OEMs and consumers maximum flexibility. Again, this is very forward-looking and strong validation for leading automakers. 
This is what we call, top of that we are the only supplier who can provide a full suite of connected services that leverage cloud and data analytics increasingly becoming important for auto industry. We're all aware of the benefits of the Connected Car. At the same time, we cannot sacrifice security for functionality. To complete HARMAN's 5-plus 1 security network, which is already the most comprehensive in the industry, we announced acquisition of [indiscernible]. Tellis Sechrist the global automotive cybersecurity company specializing in actual production for connectivity goes. Tellis sic technology will be integrated into HARMAN's 5-plus 1 security architecture aimed at protecting the critical points of in the connected and autonomous car. We expect to close this transaction shortly.  This will be our second entirely based cybersecurity acquisition. As a reminder, Redbend gave us  2 of the critical element of the 5-plus 1 architecture, the hyper visor layer and the overlayer of data technology, and now we brought2 two Telesat [indiscernible] production control. 
Let me take a close look at our divisions and review some recent notable achievements. Starting with Connected Car division, which is highlighted on Slide 6 of our investor presentation. HARMAN launched embedded infotainment solutions on a number of new vehicle models, including the new Genesis luxury brand for Hyundai. The system is now available in Korea on board the Genesis EQ 900 and will be available in Europe, North America by mid-2016. The Connected Car division also received follow-on business from Subaru. Our first award if you remember across our line entry and mid-and high worldwide we received sometime earlier and it is expected to go in SOP mode in fiscal year 2017. Additionally, HARMAN announced a strategic partnership with Microsoft to bring new model and cloud-based services to our automotive market. That's a first in the industry. The first implementation of this partnership is to integrate key elements of the Microsoft Office 365 productivity suite. Working with Microsoft is a natural fit for HARMAN. As we continue our track record of partnering to integrate the best solutions into cars for consumers. 
Now turning to the Lifestyle Audio division, which is starting to become my second favorite. Some of our recent notable achievements are highlighted on Slide 7 of our investor presentations. We had an extremely strong holiday season in consumer audio. As I mentioned earlier, we are experiencing phenomenal success with our award-winning line of affordable speakers. On top of that, our headphones are also gaining momentum in the market. You may know, HARMAN is already #1 worldwide in the sports headphones. In November, HARMAN reviewed the JBL Everest wireless headphones exclusively for the 3 largest consumer electronics retailers, Best Buy in the United States, Connect in France and me to in Germany. Our strategy partnership with Under Armour, the fastest growing apparel and health and wellness fitness company will bring to market new and meaningful innovation in the fast-growing connected health and connected fitness space. It's all about connectivity.  At CES, we introduced our first 2 cobranded products, wireless headphones for the new JBL Under Armour Bluetooth headphones with heart rate monitoring. The heart rate headphones won a CES 2016 Editor's Choice Award. 
And now turning to car audio, audio an essential part of Connected Car experience. It is no more than just having a great music experience. You need it for connectivity. An award-winning car audio solutions and powerful portfolio of brands continue to resonate with drivers leading to another strong quarter of growth. [indiscernible] have a 20-plus percent EBITDA margin business going up on a top line business. HARMAN secured new car from Audi, BMW, GE, Volvo among others. In addition, HARMAN secured first customer for industry-first for this refers individual China's own technology, you might have seen that last year in our CES booth and we have secured an order from a European OEM. That's a strong proof point of HARMAN's excellence in car engineering and product design. 
Our car audio solutions continue to expand across car lines globally. The branded audio solutions that launched during the quarter included Harley-Davidson, Roadglide with HARMAN Kardon, Toyota Prius with JBL, Nexus GS with Mark Levinson, and Hyundai Acqueous with Lexicon. As you may recall, last year, we acquired Bang & Olufsen automotive audio business. And we have now integrated HARMAN Technologies into the Bang & Olufsen product line. As a result, we're winning new awards and industry recognitions. We are also getting traction with NL play, a second brand targeting the mass market. Our Bang & Olufsen Car and audio solution in the Audi Q7 won the best sound system latest choice award from [indiscernible] in Germany. 
At CES, we showcased our new Summit car audio platform, representing the pinnacle of car audio, addressing the growing demand for personalization and adaptability through flexible software solutions. This scalable platform integrates the best of HARMAN's sound processing and sound management technologies such as Quantum Logic surround sound, individual sound zones and Clarify, along with new features like connected jukebox and virtual menus to create an unprecedented in-car audio experience for drivers. We also introduced the industry-first Infinity [indiscernible] drive, which seamlessly integrate Lifestyle Audio for the whole car and on-the-go. [indiscernible] won the Best of CES Award -- I mean, Best of CES Award. With Summit advisor drive we now have scalable car audio platform, system-on-chip global flexibility modular and scalable that can serve an entire spectrum of the car audio market from high end luxury to entry-level. 
Now turning to Professional Solutions division highlighted on Slide 8 on the investor presentation, during the quarter, we were selected by [indiscernible] integrators and installers around the world. Some notable products include the Dubai Opera House, Newport Station, the USC School of Business and ESPN Studios in Mexico City. HARMAN's products also followed a wide range of events including New Year's Eve in Times Square and the World AIDS Day concert in Carnegie Hall.  Division launched our 12 new major products during the quarter, several of which were recognized by industry associations. 
Now let me update you on the 2 important strategic initiatives we are implementing in this division to take the performance to a whole new level. First, our go-to-market approach. On October 1, our sales structure was realigned to better capitalize on our unique end to end solution including audio, video, lighting and control of enterprise and control systems for enterprise segment and entertainment segments. With this new structure, we are better-positioned to bring complete and tailored solution to different vertical markets. This is happening, takes a little bit of a time to adjust for our distributors and dealers and [indiscernible] but it's going very well. And personally visited many of the customers end points. Second initiative, we are on track to complete our plans to improve our European manufacturing footprints which was significantly bring our costs down. We are consolidating our professional product manufacturing centers in Denmark and the U.K. into a single, more cost efficient Hungarian facility. The first of those consolidation was completed in December, while the second one is well underway and expected to be fully operational by end of March. That is right on plan. As I mentioned previously, we expect to realize the full benefits from these strategic initiatives in our fiscal 2017. 
Now turning to the Connected Services division, highlighted on Slide 9 of the Investor presentation. During the quarter, HARMAN began providing software product development services to new customers, including intervisitor and alliance view lines few. Connected Services also secured follow-on business from Nielsen, Polycom, [indiscernible] and a new car company, and DealerTrak, also, a major automotive dealer network in the United States. Now that is part of cost automotive. In addition, we continue building the background for our industry-leading OPE software update technology winning awards with Honda in Japan, Jaguar Land Rover, et cetera. Our OTS solutions are not only updating infotainment systems, but also other non-HARMAN ECUs in the car.  In the case of Jaguar Land Rover, we'll be updating the telematics control unit [indiscernible]. As you can see, we're getting momentum with our OTA business. Lending on our success for Daimler and Subaru in automotive and KDDI mobile in Japan, we now have secured over $100 million worth of OTA business over the last 12 months, and expect to continue this momentum. This is again a very pleasant news for us, and that's exactly what we expected. 
During the quarter, Connected Services was recognized as a top global R&D services provider by the respected advisory firm [indiscernible] know place HARMAN in the leadership so on, the highest category across multiple industry verticals. In addition, several of HARMAN's aftermarket products won CES Innovation Award, including the JBL Legend Infinity Geer 5, JBL SmartBass and JBL Trip. At CES, we showcased our cloud based end to end service delivery platform for the Connected Car. This platform allows automakers and service providers to introduce and easily deploy new enterprise cloud services to connected vehicles. With our service delivery platform, HARMAN was partnered with OEMs to provide a number of new service offerings, including a very interesting features and adding new software features after the car is being sold. Connecting local data to predict part failures, forecasting for preventive maintenance and enabling OEMs and dealers to address software issues in the field more efficiently without making a call. This industry first service delivery platform, and I repeat, this is the industry's first service delivery platform, addresses the existing and future demand for scalability, security and flexibility in the provisioning of Connected Car services for automaker and their customers. 
Additionally, Google selected HARMAN to be the first system integration partner for [indiscernible]. Its android-based IoT developer platform. They were also selected HARMAN as a first honor to be [indiscernible] Google's communication partner for IoT devices. This positions HARMAN is a technology partner of choice for device manufacturer to design and develop products for a range of key IoT applications, serving the smart home, consumer, automotive and enterprise segments. Let me remind you, our collaboration with Google spans over a decade, from the development and scaling of Android-based ecosystem across mobile devices and consumer equipment as a member of the open handset alliance to automotive, as a member of Google's Open Automotive Alliance, and now, IoT. Our partnership with market leaders like Microsoft and Google will allow us to expand our customer base across automotive, mobile app communications and enterprise. 
In summary, I am extremely pleased with our strong financial results for the first half, which are in line with our expectations. As you would expect, we are closely monitoring recent macroeconomic headwinds, but at this point, we are on track to deliver on our full year plan. In addition, we are seeing good momentum in building our backlog. Finally, I am energized by our continued innovation. That has been differentiating HARMAN from anybody else. In addition, several of HARMAN's other initiative which are in place. Innovation and a strong partnerships that we have formed this year that will drive further growth. All of these factors position HARMAN for sustainable long-term growth. 
Now I will turn the call over to our Chief Financial Officer, Sandy Rowland, who will give you additional color in our financial results for the quarter.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Dinesh, and good morning, everyone. Let me walk you through our financial highlights for the quarter. As a reminder, most of my financial remarks are provided on an operational basis which excludes restructuring, non-recurring acquisition-relat
componenttext:
Thank you, Dinesh, and good morning, everyone. Let me walk you through our financial highlights for the quarter. As a reminder, most of my financial remarks are provided on an operational basis which excludes restructuring, non-recurring acquisition-related item. I want to point out that majority of the difference between our GAAP an operational result is due to the non-cash amortization of intangible assets recognize as a result of our recent acquisition. Before reconciliation of our GAAP to our operational results is included in the press release that we issued this morning. This quarter, our revenues were $1.8 billion, an increase of 12% compared to the prior year or 19%, excluding the impact of foreign currency translation. Excluding the impact of acquisitions and FX, our net sales increased 12%. Revenue in our Connected Car there is an increased 2% versus the prior year or 9% excluding the impact of foreign exchange. The increase in net sales was due to higher take rates, stronger automotive production and the expansion of recently launched platforms. 
Revenue in our Lifestyle Audio division increased 20% compared to the prior year or 26%, excluding foreign exchange. The increase in net sales was primarily due to new product introductions and expanded global distribution channels in consumer audio. In our Car Audio business, the increase in sales was driven by the acquisition of the Bang & Olufsen car audio business and higher take rates. 
Revenue in our Professional Solutions division increased [ph] 7% compared to the prior year or 4% excluding foreign exchange, mainly due to weakness in emerging markets, particularly Brazil and Russia. Revenue in our Connected Car Services Division was $170 million in the quarter compared to $74 million a year ago. The increase in revenue was primarily due to the expansion of our services portfolio as a result of the acquisition of Symphony Teleca. Total company gross margin increased 60 basis points to 30.8%. The improvement was primarily due to improved leverage of fixed costs as a result of higher sales volume, as well as the expansion of our services portfolio. Connected Car gross margin increased 60 basis points to 25% primarily due to better leverage of fixed costs and lower warranty costs. Lifestyle Audio gross margin increased 50 basis points to 32.7%, primarily due to improved operating leverage as a result of higher sales volume. Professional Solutions gross margin increased 100 basis points to 41.4% driven by lower manufacturing expenses. And Connected Services gross margins were 33.2%. 
Our SG&A expense as a percentage of net sales increased 30 basis points from the prior year to 20.3% due to higher investments in research and development. Connected Car SG&A declined 30 basis points to 13% and Lifestyle Audio SG&A decreased 110 basis points to 18.2%, both due to improved operating leverage on higher sales. SG&A expenses in Professional Solutions increased 190 basis points to 29.9% due to lower sales volume. Connected Services SG&A as a percentage of sales was 22 2%. And finally, corporate SG&A as a percentage of sales remains relatively flat compared to the prior year.  Consolidated operating income was $186 million compared to $162 million in the prior year, a 15% increase or 21% excluding the impact of foreign exchange. Our EPS was $1.84 compared to $1.79 in the prior year, up 3% or 9% excluding FX. 
Now let me provide with a few updates on capital allocation. Fiscal year-to-date, we have repurchased approximately 495,000 shares at a cost of $50 million. We have approximately $450 million remaining on our board authorized share repurchase program. While liquidity position continues to be strong, we have sufficient cash and access to our revolving credit facility to make the second payment for Symphony Teleca and to close the Telesat acquisition which we anticipate closing shortly. In light of current market conditions, we do expect to repurchase additional shares in the second half of this fiscal year. As Dinesh said earlier, we are on track to deliver on our revenue and earnings targets for our core business. Assuming our acquisition of Telesat closes expected over the next few weeks, it will be deleted to earnings by approximately $0.05 as it is a bolt-on technology investment. Let me also remind you of the traditional seasonality in our businesses. Production tends to be slower in our fiscal third quarter and the annual price reductions in the automotive businesses also occurs in this quarter. We also have a higher interest payments as a result of making the second payment on Symphony Teleca and closing the Telesat acquisition. 
Overall, we are very pleased with our strong first-half results despite the foreign currency headwinds and broad macroeconomic uncertainty, we have performed well and are well-positioned for continued growth in our core businesses. 
Thank you for your attention. Dinesh and I are now happy to take your questions.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016

componenttext: [Operator Instructions]  our first question comes from the line of Ryan Brinkman of JPMorgan.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: So firstly, just on the growth in Connected Car, I know you started the call explaining that the first half growth rate was very strong. In think about that deceleration though in organic growth from 1Q to 2Q, and wondered if you could point out anything
componenttext: So firstly, just on the growth in Connected Car, I know you started the call explaining that the first half growth rate was very strong. In think about that deceleration though in organic growth from 1Q to 2Q, and wondered if you could point out anything that could, of course, that, for example, a customer segment mix shift that may have impacted you may be more exposed to vehicles in China with over 1.6 liter engines for government tax incentives or something like that they're going. What's that deceleration always contemplated when you issued your full year guidance. I know you don't guide quarterly, but is there anything we should take into account when thinking about cadence through the rest of the year?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Ryan, great question. First of all, we are on plan and our take rates continue to expand. And only different sequentially we had unusually strong first quarter, as you all know, and that we had in Q2, China slightly [indiscernible] as you pointed out, Chi
componenttext: Ryan, great question. First of all, we are on plan and our take rates continue to expand. And only different sequentially we had unusually strong first quarter, as you all know, and that we had in Q2, China slightly [indiscernible] as you pointed out, China are starting to turn the quarter and we are seeing the production going up but that's affecting qualitatively the very entry-level car and you will start to see some pickup in products most likely in the third and fourth quarter, more on fourth quarter as high end costs start to come in. And we will also expect our second half is more back-loaded as it would be an extension. So we'll also see that. So all in all, we guided 13% for the full year. We're running at 14% on a constant-currency basis first half. We expect to meet our guidance and we are very comfortable with that.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: So let me take the first part and I think our CFO will take the other [ph] part. So first, half for the car audio was good. We have been beating the plan and second half looks good as well. In all these new relations, David, saw the CES actually being add
componenttext: So let me take the first part and I think our CFO will take the other [ph] part. So first, half for the car audio was good. We have been beating the plan and second half looks good as well. In all these new relations, David, saw the CES actually being additional expansion of our expertise as well as new technologies so that's a car audio. And what's working very well in tandem as we have been saying for a number of years that as you build the brand for consumers high end business protocols and others, it is really helping us and do that take rate. So consumer business really performed extremely well and you know by now, we do not take this business sacrificing our bottom line. So consumer business is holding and expected profitability and still growing the top line and car audio is a very robust profitable business. It is rolling $2 billion, $1 billion of that came from car audio, so now we have, as of last year fiscal close we have 6 million -- $6.2 billion was in car audio backlog, now we had another $1 billion. So for the revenue of when billion dollars business we are sitting with 7-plus billion high-margin business, I'm really excited. So this is how Connected Car will come alive. The more and more we are seeing audio, tuner, audio management, connectivity, safety, security and end to end services being pulled in. So all of the new awards, they will not be placed based on single basis, total solution so car audio is becoming a very integral part and important part going forward.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: And David, you take the second part of your question on foreign exchange. The hedges that we have put in place are really doing their job and protecting our P&L. I would tell you that this quarter, we got a benefit from our hedges from a transactional per
componenttext: And David, you take the second part of your question on foreign exchange. The hedges that we have put in place are really doing their job and protecting our P&L. I would tell you that this quarter, we got a benefit from our hedges from a transactional perspective somewhere in the range between $20 million and $25 million. We do have now over to $2.2 billion of hedges in place that will run for the next several years, and for fiscal year '17, we also have about the same amount of hedges that we have in place for this year at a very constant rate. So I'd say, overall, we're very pleased with the performance of our hedges and glad we have put them on a long-term basis.

You kind of restated your 30% goal for the year, can you give us some color within that on how your revenue breaks out between what you may call the high end scalable systems versus mid-range? As you see more growth in CarPlay and Android Auto, what does that mean for embedded may have and is embedded in every a pass through for you? Can you really given address elements of that debate.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: First of all, Brian, thank you for your question. We guided the market for 13% growth in fiscal '16 over last year on a constant-currency basis, and we are 14% year-to-date. And as I said, we reiterate this and we feel comfortable. In terms of breakdown o
componenttext: First of all, Brian, thank you for your question. We guided the market for 13% growth in fiscal '16 over last year on a constant-currency basis, and we are 14% year-to-date. And as I said, we reiterate this and we feel comfortable. In terms of breakdown of embedded infotainment system, if you look around other cars, 25% [ph] have full-blown embedded system and 50% of the car, let me go straight to the biggest opportunity area, the 50% of the cars are coming out even nothing just a whole, or they take in. That is a business -- which is turning into an opportunity for us. And even it will grow to full embedded system, ours will grow into, we call it display audio. Display audio would be a smart display unit but it will now the smart links like various car lines, Apple's CarPlay, Google's Android link, automotive link and many others. So we are seeing the convergence that 50% and moving very fast into fully embedded with everything or into [indiscernible]. So we also ask about our revenue. We don't break out majorities of our business is mid-segment and high-end. We also do, in all of these cars, where customers are asking we are integrating and drive Google Link, CarPlay, SLS, various car like, we're actually the first company to integrate Baidu CarLife ever in the industry. So that is just on top of it, it is not in lieu of that. However, when I mentioned earlier to Brian's question, very many entry-level car in China being produced. They don't have anything. So you might see the production from when you look at ICH Orion, the production going up but they don't have anything. When cars from Japan, Korea, China -- not China, the United States or Germany where they are shipped to China or even produced there, there you will see us assistance entry system, medium system or high-end system.

componenttext: Adam, first of all, and thank you for your question. Yes, we saw that. As you know, we are actually working on a very large end to end cost car line global contract with its customer and that is going extremely well. In fact last week when I was in Detroit opening our brand-new facility for 1,000 engineers in Michigan. We had a very big contingent and going to further review and came out extremely pleased. This would be the first of its kind, commercial development based on Android and hybrid, great infotainment integrating the 4G LTE conductivity and everything else you can think off. We are very happy with that and the car you mentioned, that's a showcase and is not ours in the production. When it comes in production, we are all out there. I mean, we have this account and we're very pleased, we have not had SOP yet but once SOP have an, it is a very good launch plan as well as our very special plan. And I can't wait for that to happen.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016

componenttext: Sticking with Connected Car, wondering if you're seeing any change in sort of growth rates of sort of mass volumes versus luxury or within mass maybe some of the orders for infotainment, the option level keep changing a little bit just subsequently, that's what we're hearing out there and economies, the bifurcation. And then also just I'm pleased to hear you say you're comfortable sort of the second half. If I look at the margin performance in Connected Car, you're running a little bit above what the guidance should of implied as well, maybe you can talk a little bit on that and what's driving that? Is there something that offsets that in the back half or are things just coming a little bit better?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Right, so Joe, great question. Thank you. First of all, on the margin, we are very pleased with the first half performance whatever we guided, we have a year ahead 13.6%, we're running 14% right now, so we are happy. But we also keep in mind that for Q3 w
componenttext:
Right, so Joe, great question. Thank you. First of all, on the margin, we are very pleased with the first half performance whatever we guided, we have a year ahead 13.6%, we're running 14% right now, so we are happy. But we also keep in mind that for Q3 which we are in, traditionally, as it gets hit with annual price reductions, so that's already built into that guidance. So that would have an impact but we would need to be. Right now, we are saying we are going to meet guidance for the margin. So that looks good and other part of the question was related to, let's see, how's that development happening. Well, first of all, as you know, very well, the high-end  cars we are in very strong position worldwide. That's very high to begin with, so we rely on the production increase as the gross we will gain because there's not so much credit movement. The biggest take improvement is coming from mid-segment where we are very strong player. In fact, majority of our backlog today is in that segment even if it is coming from general automakers, because they also mid-segment.
[Audio Gap]
So we have been working, in fact, we may recall, with the fast tier 1 to integrate iPhone Out from Apple. It is very first of the world so we go back to the history of the business and other parts of their product lines. And Google, we also go back 10 years in the directly HARMAN system as well as services business, Connected Services. They're actually very strong services partner for product development and we are a member of open handset alliance, we are a member of open automotive alliance and we are the only company to date doing a commercial level development of android-based hybrid infotainment system which will be future proof. You can personalize it, you can keep it up-to-date current with 4G LTE built into it so we're very happy with that. So experience wise, I think they are learning a lot you might have seen in terms of press release from some of the Bay Area companies was making a lot of headlines freeze on hiring in automotive states. Well, we're all learning. The automotive industry is complex. We had been saying for a long time that we have players like HARMAN with very competitive ecosystem knowledge and investing in innovation of cybersecurity connectivity and also end to end services was bug unlike the headsets or handsets, we launched them would take them, we can't do that show with that said, I think automakers have renewed confidence in companies like HARMAN and our other [indiscernible]. And as I said, I can just underscore what CES this year wants. It is the best CES ever for HARMAN. We have with our customers with our new customers thinking twice and with a lot of activity out there, It was very busy right now, and that's a good thing.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016

componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Tavis McCourt with Raymond James.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: I've got a few shares so I'll just list them in order. First, Dinesh, you haven't talked much about the Connected Services business and we don't really know the seasonality of this. But if the guidance of the year would have to have greater revenues in th
componenttext: I've got a few shares so I'll just list them in order. First, Dinesh, you haven't talked much about the Connected Services business and we don't really know the seasonality of this. But if the guidance of the year would have to have greater revenues in the second half and the first half. So is that something that we should expect on a seasonal basis? Second one, Sandy, you mentioned a little bit on FX, but can you remind us what the transactional FX headwind is to EBIT or EBITDA this year? And then your comments about a similar amount of hedges next year, does that mean that the headwind next year on FX, all else being equal, should be about the same as of the headwind this year gets worse or better next year? And then the last one, more strategic, Dinesh, so in the last few weeks, Ford clearly have gotten very aggressive announcing at CES they're basically making infotainment standard on every car and then I guess, AT&T announced a couple of days ago that they're going to embed LTE on every Ford vehicle. So we're seeing at least Ford take this from an option to something that's more standard fit and obviously, that's not a big customer of your connected car business, but you kind of have the other 2 big U.S. manufacturers who are. So I'm wondering what you're hearing from them in terms of competitive response or kind anything in the industry that you think maybe Ford could be a tipping point here to move that attach rate up significantly from the smaller increases we've seen in the last couple of years.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Raymond, first of all, a very good quality question. And let me take number one and three and Sandy will take the FX questions. The very first one was Connected Services business seasonality first half versus second half. Yes, this business has seasonalit
componenttext: Raymond, first of all, a very good quality question. And let me take number one and three and Sandy will take the FX questions. The very first one was Connected Services business seasonality first half versus second half. Yes, this business has seasonality, and typically second half in the business is stronger and exactly that's how we see it. We do carry a little bit of a backlog, but we do not report that to the backlog that we report does not have -- has nothing to do with the services but we track that backlog, we have it. The second half is stronger and will make the guidance we have given you and we feel good about. It's growing, actually. And you mentioned about customers in the U.S., you mentioned Ford, you mentioned GM, AT&T, I actually see it very positively to just validate what you said. This is where it's going and that's what you might have been seen us pushing full integration of telematics and reinvesting in telematics as well. That's why we acquired Redband, Redband in Honda car, actually, and JLR, we will be upgrading the ECUs through telematics and we're investing in telematics, we are going second-generation telematics solution end to end for Daimler cars right now. So telematics will be big for us and telematics will drive connectivity and higher penetration, whether through telematics but they have an offering and we're investing. So I see a very important announcement coming from Ford, and by the way, you mentioned GM, that they have also announced they have Ford GLD built into every single car. So I am very pleased that automakers are recognizing and making the right investment to have the connectivity secure upfront. And once you have a secure conductivity in the car with OTA, we will be able to bring latest feature functionality even when the car has left the dealership and keep it current, update the firmware, software applications, even people like you and I can personalize our experience, we can buy, what you want to buy. A lot of that is happening. So telematics is a big piece and we are right in the middle of it.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: And then Tavis, I'll take the second part of your question on foreign exchange. You are right, if you look at fiscal year '15 compared to fiscal year '16, we are still seeing some headlands on the transactional FX. We would estimate that, that's tracking
componenttext: And then Tavis, I'll take the second part of your question on foreign exchange. You are right, if you look at fiscal year '15 compared to fiscal year '16, we are still seeing some headlands on the transactional FX. We would estimate that, that's tracking right around 50 basis points across the total company. And when I look forward out on our situation for fiscal year '17, we have the same value of hedges in place for both '16 in '17. So the variation will be expect some growth in our business, but we also get productivity out of our suppliers. So those will have offsetting impacts. And then the uncertainty is around the 25% that we don't hedge because you're running right around the USD 1.10 euro exchange that we have planned. It could be a higher rate next year and we see a tailwind if it dips again with the headwind. So what we don't know is the unhedged piece but still looking like in pretty good shape in that area.

componenttext: Two questions on the event technology front. The first is around your monetization strategy within cybersecurity. At CES, you started to discuss Redband and their 5 plus 1 strategy, you begin to over cyber solutions for competing infotainment providers what would be maybe a 2 [ph] saw first I licensing model perhaps. Could you give us any more color around the timing, market size for such a great opportunity? And then I can ask a follow-up question after.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, first of all, good afternoon, and thank you for joining us. It's a great one. It is emerging, and I'll tell you where we are. So it is true, we acquired Redband, they're already engaged with multiple Tier 1s like HARMAN and HARMAN's competitors. Fir
componenttext: Okay, first of all, good afternoon, and thank you for joining us. It's a great one. It is emerging, and I'll tell you where we are. So it is true, we acquired Redband, they're already engaged with multiple Tier 1s like HARMAN and HARMAN's competitors. First, thing we did, I myself joined the incoming CEO to talk to various tailwinds to tell them that will keep at arm's length just like we did many years when we [indiscernible] because this is an industry solution. We don't need to monopolize that, and we want everybody to benefit. And it's not just infotainment, it actually will update of firmware, software, various other ETU's supply by many of the other Tier 1s. That is ready happening and will happen and I hope it will happen because it is by far, the best OTA upgraded technology. Now coming back to monetization, it goes, first of all, as I said, we have booked $100 million of business, that is all software. So when it starts to go to the the revenue conversion, it is a very high margin business, as you would expect. In terms of how we charge, it is either licensing model, sometimes it is car licensed to the warranty as OEMs, may want to have it all in a subscription. Sometimes it is by model. So it's different, different packaging at Redbend before we acquired have been doing. Right now, we are trying to streamline and also working with major automakers where we have bigger opportunity, how do we sort of do create a model. And so basically it's a new stream are recurring revenue will come once the red band is there as a server as well as a client which is fitting in the car so it's just like anything which needs to be kept always alive and you get paid for. So we see a big opportunity because now you may start to a term no one else want to talk yet, it is called data. However, manages the data is the big winner. We will manage data through our Connected Services division and Redbend will provide the data exchange, whether you're AT&T, Verizon, China Mobile, Vodafone, they provide the plumbing and we are the mechanism for secure data exchange and update of the data. So we will be having data, and that data will go to OEMs, to dealers for the diagnostics, for consumer behavior, for insurance companies, to wellness, health, so we will be doing that in the management so we feel very good about. And that's where Redbend is part of our Connected Services division where we have our cloud management applications, we have our analytics division, very strong analytics engine, combine that with Redbend, you got a powerful services business and that's services business is calling on HARMAN competitors and all car companies directly.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: And you probably can't discuss pricing with too much detail. Is there any way to think about as a percentage of a cost of an infotainment system what cybersecurity as a software solution could be?
componenttext: And you probably can't discuss pricing with too much detail. Is there any way to think about as a percentage of a cost of an infotainment system what cybersecurity as a software solution could be?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: So I will try to answer it -- let me try  to make an attempt. One attempt -- 1 way we can do is to have a per car basis charge for 5-plus 1 cybersecurity framework that we have. Because we believe that's a total solution, it's most comprehensive. So you c
componenttext: So I will try to answer it -- let me try  to make an attempt. One attempt -- 1 way we can do is to have a per car basis charge for 5-plus 1 cybersecurity framework that we have. Because we believe that's a total solution, it's most comprehensive. So you can price it and carmakers will pay it. Without a doubt, we are already seeing that. All you could do, that we can say, look, HARMAN will start the package cybersecurity 5-plus 1 and including Redbend technology in every single new offering will come out from now on, and that will be priced as a bundle. But that will be an association, and that's the way I like to think you maintain price-performance ratio, you maintain going forward, you do not lose the pricing. You maintain the pricing power, but you keep adding features, feature functionality exponentially. So you keep your margins and continue to build margin and your leverage will give you the better margin. We will probably go both ways. Some customers who do not do business with us from infotainment to car audio, they're already using our Redbend and cybersecurity technology. They will pay us on a license basis. Those who are buying complete system from us, it will be totally embedded so they will get the whole offering and we'll get paid for the system. And one more thing, you might have seen HARMAN had always commanded better price for our infotainment system in the industry, because we always will be in the cutting-edge of technology and this is cutting-edge. So when you start to price it in, we'll continue to have better pricing.

componenttext: Sure, so David, first of all, we are very important [indiscernible] we're just randomly coming in, so thank you for taking time to ask the question. As you know, very well, auto orders are never smooth on a quarterly basis or even year-over-year basis was a bumper year, I'll call it, we have $4.3 billion worth of infotainment awards and $1 billion -- $1.9 billion in car audio, so put it all together we have $6.2 billion phenomenal for a revenue of $4 billion. So we had a bumper year, you don't expect that we guided on CMN be because we always have visibility in RSQ and what orders will close. So for this year we have $2 billion already in the bag and that's 50%, $1 billion came from infotainment and $1 billion came from car audio. And we're not done yet, you know that. So we're very happy with the development this year. It's actually on plan slightly ahead of plan in terms of order bookings.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Got you. The second question I have and sort of struggling with this, infotainment revenues Connected Car went down quarter-over-quarter. It seems like European production was up quarter-over-quarter and North America was flat and I'm sort of piggybacking
componenttext: Got you. The second question I have and sort of struggling with this, infotainment revenues Connected Car went down quarter-over-quarter. It seems like European production was up quarter-over-quarter and North America was flat and I'm sort of piggybacking on Ryan's question, but is there something unusual? I mean, are you guys have plans for launches or is there something you can provide into more detail relating to that?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: You're right, obviously, we track. In fact, if you look at the global production, we guided to 3.5% for the whole world as a weighted average for all the regions. And we're pretty closely tracking global production even from puts and takes its the same. S
componenttext: You're right, obviously, we track. In fact, if you look at the global production, we guided to 3.5% for the whole world as a weighted average for all the regions. And we're pretty closely tracking global production even from puts and takes its the same. So we have seen China particularly a slight softening for the high end luxury cars which, we believe, is a temporary shift or actually postponement of the purchase, that's the view of our company, customers. So it will come back. I don't think it has anything to do with new production going up in North America flat or declining. It has to do with SOP timing, SOP expansion. Q1 we have pretty strong SOP launch in [indiscernible] and that we benefited. Now they are flat, or it's still growing so we're seeing some improvement and Q3 and Q4, we have a number of SOPs coming in and that's why I said earlier that we will deliver on our guidance we gave in spite of some of the headwinds we're seeing in China or Russia [indiscernible].

componenttext: Going back to the Connected Car segment a little bit and talk about that recurring revenue, as you think out Dinesh you said kind of business ramps and obviously it should entirely ramp pretty quick over the next 3 to 5 years, do you have any like internal or thoughts regarding what percentage or kind of recurring revenue you would anticipate that business to kick off? Obviously, that would be one dynamic kind of make it more recurring revenue model than a little bit of the lumpiness quarter-to-quarter on productions or take rates or things like that in terms of your overall business.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: So first, of all, thank you for asking the question. I will give you my view as I see. By no means, the guidance for any expectations. Look, everybody talks about whether it is IHS, whether it is LMC or customers, any resource that's 65%, 70% take rates a
componenttext: So first, of all, thank you for asking the question. I will give you my view as I see. By no means, the guidance for any expectations. Look, everybody talks about whether it is IHS, whether it is LMC or customers, any resource that's 65%, 70% take rates and that is going to happen 3 years or 5 years, but you're right, it's going to happen in 3 to 5 years. Not going to be beyond 5 years. It's happening in that period. If that happens, right now, industry average this year is supposed to be around 27%, 28% take rates, this number goes up to 65%, 70%. Guess who's going to benefit the most? It's HARMAN we're going to be working 9, 10 of the large OEMs of the 15 sitting with $23 billion backlog plus $2 billion we had booked this year. That backlog is based on current take rates. So you could double that thing am I just double from 27%, 28% to 55%. If the number goes up. That's why I get excited in 3, 5 years time, potentially if anything goes well as the industry said, HARMAN could see our revenue doubling again. And that's why I said I was opening our new center, because we don't know more than 1 year at a time. We only have visibility 1 year, but 5 years out, is it possible? You bet it's possible. Plus I think another very important piece which will drive take rates is connected services. OEM is struggling one thing, they don't know or they are not quite sure enough on how to create the back and connectivity to servers, the upload of data, the download of data analytics and make sense out of it and that Connected Services piece as right our acquisition that, that will transformational move will be made and after that, to people have also talked him going in that direction but there are not too many targets like Symphony Teleca. So we're very excited about that. So I've been very optimistic, if not quite clearly because it is embedded in here, embedded within the day, embedded is not pushing out by the way, on phones. They will also be integrated but the way our car industry is going is fully embedded and we will gain from that.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q2 2016 Earnings Call, Jan 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, I will say in closing, first of all, a big thank you for your time for joining us today and thank you to our shareholders, our owners of the company, investors, and very importantly, our analyst community for all the hard work you do. It's a tremend
componenttext: Well, I will say in closing, first of all, a big thank you for your time for joining us today and thank you to our shareholders, our owners of the company, investors, and very importantly, our analyst community for all the hard work you do. It's a tremendous work, for your support and what you do to communicate the HARMAN story. And in the last sentence, I would say, this is my ninth year. I've seen a lot of ups and downs in our industry, what has appreciated HARMAN is the innovation and the R&D. We have clearly shown the last 4, 5 years, margin expansion, top line expansion and further growth. Whatever we have said, we have delivered. Our team is solid, we are excited, we have a good customer base and we have the technology platform in place, especially in all the latest generation compute platform. We just launched at CES, it's one of a kind, it's unique. I'm very excited for the future. I cannot control what happens, day to day, right but I do know I can control the direction of our company with my team. So with that, thank you all very much for your time.
