componenttext: And our next question is from Brian Johnson with Barclays.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: A couple of things back on Connected Car. They're kind of related. First is you had a program that you signed back in late 2012 about a $2 billion program that you had talked about launching 2017 model year. Are we going to see any of that this fiscal yea
componenttext: A couple of things back on Connected Car. They're kind of related. First is you had a program that you signed back in late 2012 about a $2 billion program that you had talked about launching 2017 model year. Are we going to see any of that this fiscal year? Are we likely to see it next fiscal year? And what sort of product was that?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: So first of all, that's a great program for us. It's one-of-a-kind commercial development. It's a large program, actually, one of the largest program we have undertaken. It's going extremely well. And this will be launched -- I mean, a number of factors f
componenttext: So first of all, that's a great program for us. It's one-of-a-kind commercial development. It's a large program, actually, one of the largest program we have undertaken. It's going extremely well. And this will be launched -- I mean, a number of factors from the OEM side will dictate and a lot of changes being added to it, but we are on track. We do not mention future SOP timing. In fact, I've been hurt by saying, let OEM speak for it. And as we have said, Brian, before that this would have a very small impact in fiscal '17. It'll start to ramp in '18. So we are on track on that. The most important thing is going quite well, the program.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Second, on this new embedded audio -- display audio award, a couple of questions. First, I think there's a lot of terminology in the industry around infotainment and sort of low end and then sort of low midrange, which is -- can still get you some f
componenttext: Okay. Second, on this new embedded audio -- display audio award, a couple of questions. First, I think there's a lot of terminology in the industry around infotainment and sort of low end and then sort of low midrange, which is -- can still get you some functions on the screen, higher midrange with Apple CarPlay, et cetera, connectivity all the way up to pure embedded, high-end embedded. Where -- when you say display audio, kind of what feature sets are we talking about?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: So glad that you asked that question. That takes us back to our August Investor Day presentation. We described that in a pie chart, draw a horizontal line to divide the pie into 2. And then the top pie gets divided into another 25, 25 percentile. 25% is t
componenttext: So glad that you asked that question. That takes us back to our August Investor Day presentation. We described that in a pie chart, draw a horizontal line to divide the pie into 2. And then the top pie gets divided into another 25, 25 percentile. 25% is the fully embedded infotainment system. That is your telematics, that's your navigation, multimedia and what have you. And then the other 25% is display audio, which I would like to describe in a simplistic word; that is really your radio with a large screen without inbuilt navigation capability. The bottom half of the pie is really your very low-end traditional AM/FM radio or nothing at all. So what's happening, the growth in the top 2 quartile of the pie, the fully embedded and display audio. Display audio has further evolved into 2 basic display unit with some CarPlay capability. That's again, as I described, not inbuilt navigation capability but bring your own device. So that happens, and we are doing that. So those 2 are fastest-growing, and people say that no bright [ph] lines align between these 2 because what I think, and I just base on what I'm hearing, that the lines will further sort of get blurred between display audio and fully embedded. But if you think and if you believe in, what's going to happen to fully connected car? What's -- what would be required in semi-autonomous car? You will have a lot more sense of fusion. You will have a lot more safety security, active safety, ATOS, telematics, full-blown navigation, built into it. Otherwise you cannot rely [ph] on car. So I think display audio will actually move more and more towards the fully embedded, and this would be in phases because people who buy entry-level car will perhaps start with that, and they will demand from technology providers, do you have a path to upgrade my system online once I have bought the car? And that's fair. What has been holding up the take rates from going 4% or 3% linearly to nonlinear is there was no mechanism to  over-the-air update technology. Only one car company in the Bay Area started doing it. And by the way, we are doing that, too, over-the-air update. So now with OTA technology we've acquired from Redbend, and we have already signed up more than 6 OEMs worldwide to use that technology. This will expedite feature refresh upgrade applications. That's why we signed up 10 providers for technology. So I think we're going to give users -- they can now customize. They can start with something if they don't have enough fund to begin with. But the all -- mid to luxury cars would be going more and more fully embedded systems. So I think as we go towards more and more autonomous driving, you will not see the bottom of the pie left at nothing, that nothing will not serve because that's the pressure everybody has. And that's what I thought I heard from all OEMs I visited extensively, Germany, Japan, China, United States. And we're hearing the same thing, the high take rates. In fact, our display audio award we have received, it had extremely high penetration rate. And I believe in it because that would be the base for the all-entry systems going forward.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: So if you think -- well, just a couple of specific questions then. Would this involve Bluetooth or some sort of Apple CarPlay or Android connectivity or at least smart -- in the system...
componenttext: So if you think -- well, just a couple of specific questions then. Would this involve Bluetooth or some sort of Apple CarPlay or Android connectivity or at least smart -- in the system...

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Absolutely. Brian, absolutely. So display audio would have features built into it to support Google, iOS, other drivers, CarPlay. Whether it's there or not, but the system would be able to switch and immediately interface with those devices as you bring i
componenttext: Absolutely. Brian, absolutely. So display audio would have features built into it to support Google, iOS, other drivers, CarPlay. Whether it's there or not, but the system would be able to switch and immediately interface with those devices as you bring in these. So these are smart systems, but they don't have full-blown 3D navigation, full-blown multimedia. But they will have lots of capabilities to grow into. But it will not be substitute to the high-end embedded system like with BMW and Audi, the Mercedes, Lexus, Cadillac, Lincoln, many high-end cars will be -- would be providing to the consumers.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. But in terms of positioning, and let's say -- because different investors have different views that the idea of embedded GPS navigation, we could debate it or not. But let's assume that there are a number of consumers who just want to rely on their
componenttext: Okay. But in terms of positioning, and let's say -- because different investors have different views that the idea of embedded GPS navigation, we could debate it or not. But let's assume that there are a number of consumers who just want to rely on their smartphone for that. I'm just trying to make sure that the display audio win that you have -- you're calling it display audio, but from what I'm hearing, it actually sounds like if I look back to Page 7 of your Investor Day deck, almost a mid-system minus app -- minus GPS and app download, which is actually provided through the smartphone.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: I think you're absolutely right. As I said this is basically your smart system without navigation. But this has all Bluetooth, hands-free capabilities, and you can bring your device and use it. It will scale up to that, whether it's a MirrorLink, whether
componenttext: I think you're absolutely right. As I said this is basically your smart system without navigation. But this has all Bluetooth, hands-free capabilities, and you can bring your device and use it. It will scale up to that, whether it's a MirrorLink, whether it's a Google link, whether it's a CarPlay, whether it's a CarLife and Baidu and many of those evolving. So those features would be available in display audio. And by the way, they're all already available in our fully embedded system. So this is the aspiration. This is the step -- first step for those who could never buy embedded system. By the way, since you mentioned 2 or 3 times the different definition, I'm also hearing different definitions. In fact, some of the competitors are using cockpit, whether it's instrument cluster or anything else, as loosely as navigation or infotainment. That is not correct. In fact, those are the standard instrument clusters. They are merging. They are getting into similar space. That's why they're also driving it, but from a capability point of view, infotainment remains very clearly well defined.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from David Tamberrino with Goldman Sachs.
componenttext: Our next question is from David Tamberrino with Goldman Sachs.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: The first one from us is, obviously, the company is going through a bit of a soft patch in top line revenue, and it's something that you've seen before, 2013 being the most recent time period where you saw a pause. I think our biggest question is, when do
componenttext: The first one from us is, obviously, the company is going through a bit of a soft patch in top line revenue, and it's something that you've seen before, 2013 being the most recent time period where you saw a pause. I think our biggest question is, when do you expect a reacceleration in the Connected Car growth? You have a few larger contracts in place. And given your sizable backlog, is that something you should be seeing or we should be seeing as we're heading out of '16 into 2017?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: David, first of all, thank you for asking a very good question. I actually don't think that it's a soft patch which I'm worried about. I think, overall, this business of connected car will still be coming out for the full year right around 10%, 11% top li
componenttext: David, first of all, thank you for asking a very good question. I actually don't think that it's a soft patch which I'm worried about. I think, overall, this business of connected car will still be coming out for the full year right around 10%, 11% top line. And lifestyle car audio business is also really firing on all cylinders. Most importantly, the indication I see, what is happening in order activity? And I'm very, very happy with that because that's the forward trend. That $23 billion was the backlog as of last year, fiscal '15. Since then, we have already booked $3.5 billion, and $2.3 billion of that came from Connected Car. And we're not done yet because Q4 is lining up to be, again, a pretty strong quarter for our order activity. So I think OEMs are coming in and placing large orders. They cannot avoid if there are some inventory issues here and there. And take rates, that's the key point for you and I to talk about because if take rates were soft, I'd be worried. But I'm not. Take rates are holding up quite well. We're tracking very well what we guided. So between production and take rates, this quarter was 65% take rate and 35% production. So even if production is modest development over the next couple of 3 years, take rate will start to get nonlinear. I absolutely believe, whether it's in '17, I -- we're not giving guidance right now, but is it '17, I don't know. But one thing for sure, every OEM is saying it's not going to take 5 years to get to 65% penetration. It may not happen first 2 years, but linear to nonlinear is going to happen anywhere from one cycle -- one life cycle. That's 2 to 3 years. 2 years may be out. So that's my take on it, but we'll have more color when we give guidance for fiscal '17 in August.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: That's fair. It's helpful. And then just touching on the new business wins, this $3.5 billion that you've announced so far, it's tracking a little bit softer year-over-year. I think you just said the 4Q -- fourth quarter is lining up to be a little bit st
componenttext: That's fair. It's helpful. And then just touching on the new business wins, this $3.5 billion that you've announced so far, it's tracking a little bit softer year-over-year. I think you just said the 4Q -- fourth quarter is lining up to be a little bit stronger year-over-year. Is that because of the lumpiness in bidding activity? Or is it you're just a little bit lighter from an RFP perspective from the OEMs?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: David, again, that's a good question you asked. Clarify a couple other things. Order activity is always lumpy. You should never expect every year to be the same. Last year, as an example, was a phenomenal and, by the way, record year for the industry and
componenttext: David, again, that's a good question you asked. Clarify a couple other things. Order activity is always lumpy. You should never expect every year to be the same. Last year, as an example, was a phenomenal and, by the way, record year for the industry and record year for HARMAN. We booked $6.2 billion. No other company has ever booked that much. We were the first one to book that high. And we actually thought that next year might be just $2 billion or $3 billion. We already booked $3.5 billion. So we're very happy. And so if you think now in different form, in last 7 quarters, 4 quarters of '15, 3 quarters of this year, we have booked $10 billion business. I mean, our second biggest competitor has not even booked $5 billion. So we have an amazing momentum going in that direction. That makes me very confident that we're on a very good path as long as we keep costs low and continue to innovate, which we are doing. And by the way, we should not forget, our connected car business will grow because we've invested in services business, in end-to-end service delivery, over-the-air update, cybersecurity. Other competitors have a lot of catching up to do because these are the requirements towards autonomous driving, towards higher penetration rate. So I'm very convinced that we're going in the right direction. Quarter-to-quarter fluctuations, I don't like it, I understand, but we have to live with it.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Appreciate that, Dinesh. And just lastly from us, on the share buybacks, looks like you had a little bit of activity during the quarter. And when you look at where the share price is today, it would be pretty attractively priced, I guess, in your view on
componenttext: Appreciate that, Dinesh. And just lastly from us, on the share buybacks, looks like you had a little bit of activity during the quarter. And when you look at where the share price is today, it would be pretty attractively priced, I guess, in your view on the return. With the $425 million you have left and a pretty strong cash flow quarter coming up, is there any upsize opportunity for you to increase the quarterly cadence of buybacks?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Obviously, that's something that we look at from quarter-to-quarter. And one thing we'll let you know is we plan to be active in the market in Q4.
componenttext: Obviously, that's something that we look at from quarter-to-quarter. And one thing we'll let you know is we plan to be active in the market in Q4.

componenttext: And also you know that we still have $425 million board-authorized repurchase program.

componenttext: And our next question is from David Lim with Wells Fargo Securities.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: So I just wanted to dive into the North American OEM. Can you give us a little bit more color on maybe when we could expect that to flow through? Is that more of an FY '18, '19? And any kind of size relative to some of your other wins in how big this can
componenttext: So I just wanted to dive into the North American OEM. Can you give us a little bit more color on maybe when we could expect that to flow through? Is that more of an FY '18, '19? And any kind of size relative to some of your other wins in how big this can be? And is it global or is it just North America? Additional color would be very helpful.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. We obviously have some constraints [indiscernible]. Otherwise I would have given you a lot more. And I hope that by August, we will be allowed to say more. But it is a global business. It's actually a little more than half of what we booked in this
componenttext: Sure. We obviously have some constraints [indiscernible]. Otherwise I would have given you a lot more. And I hope that by August, we will be allowed to say more. But it is a global business. It's actually a little more than half of what we booked in this quarter. So that's already pretty good size, and we expect -- so that's about $700 million, $800 million already is the size. But it has further opportunity to grow another few hundred million dollars worldwide. So we already got the umbrella contract done. We just have to do some local parts. And in terms of its SOP, we're not allowed to give timing, but this is a pretty fast development. It's a scalable platform, and we will be able to use a lot of technology from the platform. We use this based on Orinoco, which you saw we launched at CES '15. We're happy that platform has taken on and taken off. So this would be, well, fiscal '18 or beginning fiscal '19, I cannot judge on it. But this is good. And on the back of this success, I think we have a number of other similar pursuit in the works.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Then one follow-up question, Dinesh. I mean, it seems like the Professional division has become like a weight vest on an Olympic sprinter, if you will. Do you see -- can you sort of dimensionalize the margin from last year? I mean, was there -- was the in
componenttext: Then one follow-up question, Dinesh. I mean, it seems like the Professional division has become like a weight vest on an Olympic sprinter, if you will. Do you see -- can you sort of dimensionalize the margin from last year? I mean, was there -- was the inventory like a 200 basis point headwind to the quarter? If you guys could sort of bridge us, that would be great. And another follow-up behind that is, would you guys ever consider maybe spinning off the Professional division?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: So there are a number of things, and I think Sandy and I will answer. So let me take the first part here. We have a lot of color on this business. 2, 3 years ago, we had almost $0.5 billion worth of professional audio business. We were growing about 3%, 4
componenttext: So there are a number of things, and I think Sandy and I will answer. So let me take the first part here. We have a lot of color on this business. 2, 3 years ago, we had almost $0.5 billion worth of professional audio business. We were growing about 3%, 4% a year, and we were generating 15%, 16% EBITDA margin. And at that point, we clearly saw there was a need to create a bigger solution, audio, video switching, lighting and automation, to tie it all together to create a total solution. The businesses we acquired, they came in significantly lower profitability, and the footprint was in very, very high-cost countries, whether United States, Switzerland, Denmark and U.K. So that actually diluted the margins in the first place. And now we had to do the work. While we were integrating the IT systems, the payrolls and what have you, we had to build the sales force so that we can sell not products, but the total solution. That's going on. So we do expect once we are done with this sales channel rationalization, which means not only retraining our salespeople, bringing some new people and also adjusting to new distribution channels, including going direct in some markets, and we are doing that, by the way, we should hit mid-single digit to even high, in 2 years, 3 years' time, growth. But that's more -- most important thing is profitability. Profitability, already next year, I would like to see coming into 14%, 15% profitability for the whole division because we will have this faster consolidation already coming in. In addition, we have identified some more cost rationalization, which we will drive in fiscal '17 already. So if I can sort of speak ahead of guidance, fiscal '17, we expect right around mid-teen EBITDA margin, 14%, 15%, around that if everything goes. And '17, we should be looking at 16%, 17% even because we will have some more cost reduction rationalization. I would like to invite our CFO to also weigh on some of the inventory and some of the other things.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, David, I'll bring us back to the quarter. When you look at the year-over-year margin performance, there were 3 major factors that impacted the margin. The first that -- first, we continued doing some discounting, not only to clear out some older inve
componenttext: Yes, David, I'll bring us back to the quarter. When you look at the year-over-year margin performance, there were 3 major factors that impacted the margin. The first that -- first, we continued doing some discounting, not only to clear out some older inventory, but we need to support our global distribution partners. Some of those partners are still impacted by currency impacts due to the continued strong dollar. And then the second point is leverage. Once we get the top line going in this business, we get very good leverage on the top line. And the third factor was we did incur some incremental costs this quarter that were largely associated with migrating our footprint out of the U.K. and Denmark into our site into Hungary.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: David, last piece of your question was spinout. I don't want to miss out anything. Look, we review our portfolio with our Board of Directors on a very regular basis. We believe this is a great business. Total solution, end-to-end enterprise and entertainm
componenttext: David, last piece of your question was spinout. I don't want to miss out anything. Look, we review our portfolio with our Board of Directors on a very regular basis. We believe this is a great business. Total solution, end-to-end enterprise and entertainment. No other competitor I know of has the capability we have. Once we fix the cost base, once we fix the go-to-market challenge strategy, I really think this is -- this great business will generate ton of cash. Doesn't have too many hang-ups of project execution risk, what we all face in other parts of businesses. But I think it's relatively simpler business once we address those 2 issues, which we are in the middle of. And we like this business. But, you know what? I don't talk on behalf of board. We review every year everything openly.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: And our next question is from Adam Jonas with Morgan Stanley.
componenttext: And our next question is from Adam Jonas with Morgan Stanley.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Paresh Jain in for Adam Jonas. Dinesh, just one question, I'll stick to one here. There does seem to be some shift in the way you're thinking about display audio or smartphone-only solution versus embedded. Historically, expectations were for smar
componenttext: This is Paresh Jain in for Adam Jonas. Dinesh, just one question, I'll stick to one here. There does seem to be some shift in the way you're thinking about display audio or smartphone-only solution versus embedded. Historically, expectations were for smartphone solution to be delivered primarily through embedded. But it seems like you're sounding a bit more bullish on penetration of these solutions as stand-alone products. And just to clarify, the display audio VIN is for the product that was unveiled at CES in 2015, right?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: That is correct.
componenttext: That is correct.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And your thoughts on being more bullish on penetration of smartphone solution as stand-alone products?
componenttext: Okay. And your thoughts on being more bullish on penetration of smartphone solution as stand-alone products?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, we have always been consistent, so I'll repeat what we have always said. We have said 50% of the car market has either basic AM/FM radio or nothing at all. That would move towards fully embedded system, what we are world leader at, or some sort of a
componenttext: Well, we have always been consistent, so I'll repeat what we have always said. We have said 50% of the car market has either basic AM/FM radio or nothing at all. That would move towards fully embedded system, what we are world leader at, or some sort of a hybrid, which is the name industry has given is display audio. In fact, I don't even like it because it's not audio, it's actually infotainment. And that has capabilities pretty much what you would expect in an entry system, what we had been doing without inbuilt navigation. We have always said that that's the entry system. We have been doing entry system. But this time, it is a system which does not have a built-in navigation, which you can bring your own device. We have always been consistent on that. And I'll repeat what I said earlier in the call. I believe, towards semi-autonomous and autonomous driving experience, display audio is not your answer. Full stop. This is the beginning. This is what you get people started with, and then they can grow their system, or the first-generation car you buy, either you upgrade it, which we will develop our service offerings or you'll buy a next car, which is a lot more embedded. That has been very consistent explanation from me and my management team. And we still believe that's the way it's going. The good thing is we're playing in both sides because our customers, existing customers, the Germans, Japanese, Americans, are asking that they want both solutions because no car would be left behind, either entry car or mid- and high, and we have solution for all 3, entry, mid- and high.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: And our next question is from David Leiker with Baird.
componenttext: And our next question is from David Leiker with Baird.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Joe Vruwink for David. A question on your connected car launches in the quarter. We're seeing new Fiats in Europe and new Chrysler vehicles in the U.S. launch with the next generation of Uconnect. In your own launch highlights this quarter, Fiat o
componenttext: This is Joe Vruwink for David. A question on your connected car launches in the quarter. We're seeing new Fiats in Europe and new Chrysler vehicles in the U.S. launch with the next generation of Uconnect. In your own launch highlights this quarter, Fiat or Chrysler weren't listed. So can you maybe give us an update on when your new generation of systems will launch?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: So first of all, let me just say that Fiat Chrysler continues to be a very strong customer of HARMAN across infotainment, telematics and audio. And we are expanding in the family in multiple areas. And I have said that -- always in a consistent manner tha
componenttext: So first of all, let me just say that Fiat Chrysler continues to be a very strong customer of HARMAN across infotainment, telematics and audio. And we are expanding in the family in multiple areas. And I have said that -- always in a consistent manner that this is one customer where we have 4 or even 5 suppliers of infotainment -- at least audio, we are the largest one. And infotainment, we are also large, but there are other 4 or -- 3 or 4 suppliers. So how they distribute the business, like you just saw us launching Maserati, which we're very happy about. And a few other vehicles are coming out with HARMAN very soon with our infotainment. So explanation, we will see, we are waiting for them to decide. At the same time, R1, which is the new program that would be up for bid in next year, including minivan, HARMAN is well positioned with the technologies we are demonstrating to Chrysler Fiat, and we will wait and see what happens.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: So I guess the question would be at CES this year, they introduced the new generation -- I think it's the sixth generation of Uconnect. And it seems like that's starting to get into market. It sounds like your launches are still continuing, and it's going
componenttext: So I guess the question would be at CES this year, they introduced the new generation -- I think it's the sixth generation of Uconnect. And it seems like that's starting to get into market. It sounds like your launches are still continuing, and it's going to be on that original program and just spreading across more vehicles. Has there been any developments in that sixth generation of Uconnect for HARMAN?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Apr 28, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is -- in this case, particularly, they have been expanding and adding technology. So further expansion like -- Maserati is a classic example, Maserati has a lot of feature functionality, which an initial Uconnect did not have. And it's been very well
componenttext: This is -- in this case, particularly, they have been expanding and adding technology. So further expansion like -- Maserati is a classic example, Maserati has a lot of feature functionality, which an initial Uconnect did not have. And it's been very well received, very successful launch of HARMAN infotainment. So they have been doing that, launching some of the program in the existing car lines, some in the new car line, and they're doing the same thing with some of our competitors. As I said, this is a big group, and they have 4, 5 infotainment suppliers.

On one hand, 75% of our company's business which comes from Connected Car and Lifestyle, we're doing very well, a very strong order book. And other 2 businesses, one is under integration, the services business, which we feel we have a good handle on; Professional, we have some work to do, but we have taken decisive actions. Some more to be done, but nothing is in a blind spot here. So thank you again for your time, and we remain very excited to continue to create shareholder value in our company.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Ladies and gentlemen, thank you for standing by. Welcome to the HARMAN Fiscal Fourth Quarter 2016 Earnings Call [Operator Instructions] As a reminder, this conference is being recorded today, Thursday, August 4, 2016. I will now turn the conference over t
componenttext: Ladies and gentlemen, thank you for standing by. Welcome to the HARMAN Fiscal Fourth Quarter 2016 Earnings Call [Operator Instructions] As a reminder, this conference is being recorded today, Thursday, August 4, 2016. I will now turn the conference over to Yijing Brentano, Vice President, Investor Relations and Strategy. Please go ahead.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you. Good morning and thank you for joining our fourth quarter and full year fiscal year 2016 investor call. I'm joined in Stanford today by Dennis Sullivan, our Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer; and by Sandy Rowland, our Chief Financ
componenttext: Thank you. Good morning and thank you for joining our fourth quarter and full year fiscal year 2016 investor call. I'm joined in Stanford today by Dennis Sullivan, our Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer; and by Sandy Rowland, our Chief Financial Officer. If you have investor already, I invite you to visit the Investor section of our website, where you can download copies of our earnings release and the supporting slide presentation that we'll be referencing today. Before Dennis and Sandy provide their remarks on the quarter, let me remind you that certain statements during this conference call and question-and-answer session may be forward-looking in nature as defined in The United States Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. These forward-looking statements are based on management's beliefs, assumptions and current expectations, but are subject to a number of important risk factors and uncertainties, which have been fully described in the press release that we issued this morning. Now let me turn the call over to Dinesh.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Yijing, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. I am pleased that this morning we announced very strong results for the fourth quarter and full year. Our fourth quarter results came in stronger than our forecast with net sales interesting 12% t
componenttext:
Thank you, Yijing, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. I am pleased that this morning we announced very strong results for the fourth quarter and full year. Our fourth quarter results came in stronger than our forecast with net sales interesting 12% to $1.9 billion. We expanded our operating margins and delivered a 20% year-over-year improvement in EBITDA and a 14% year-over-year improvement in earnings per share. We successfully mitigated the supply chain disruption in our automotive business following the recent in Japan and they capitalized on increased demand for our consumer audio products in May and June. In addition, our business in China had a strong finish With record full year revenue of approximately $800 million, up nearly 20% from the prior year. I'm also pleased that the Professional Solutions division achieved our Q4 target on top and bottom line. 
The fourth quarter caps and other for HARMAN. Revenue, EBITDA and earnings per share all reached record highs. We exceeded $6.9 billion in revenue and increased up 16%, excluding foreign exchange. EBITDA improved 23% to $836 million and we grew earnings per share by 13% to $6.2. 
I am pleased to report that our automotive backlog now stands at $24.1 billion. Our technology leadership and ability to successfully deploy intelligent connector solutions for the car that are safe and secure is resonating with customers. Not only did we prevent next-generation business from existing customers, we added new automakers to our customer list. Over the last 2 years, we have added $11 billion of new automotive That is momentum. Our record automotive backlog of more than $24 billion provides HARMAN strong foundation for long-term growth. 
Now let me take a closer look at our division and review some recent notable achievements. Let's start with Connected Car division, which is highlighted on Slide 7 of your investor presentation. During the quarter, we secured several new and follow-on awards to provide Connected Car solutions for customers, including Harley-Davidson, Porsche, Toyota and a North American automaker. Advancing our Telematics strategy, we secured an award from a premium German automaker for an industry-first solution for the main gateway into the path, providing a unique connectivity platform. This solution integrates the power -- this solution integrate the powers that expended telematics features and enables system diagnostics, remote control capabilities and system software updates. The automaker will also employ HARMAN's cloud-based over-the-air update technology, ensuring that critical software fixes feature-additions and upgrades can be easily and squarely and safely transmitted and added to the vehicle while on the road. Not only for HARMAN had units but also for on-board from other Tier 1 suppliers. This comprehensive gateway platform is an industry first. HARMAN is the only supplier that these property technologies to create this end-to-end solutions. A product like this is a perfect example of how our bolt-on acquisitions are paying off. We strategically expanded our capabilities in over-the-air update technology, cybersecurity, cloud applications and data analytics. And when we combine this with our own deep expertise in connectivity technology, we can create unique solutions for our customers that are smart, safe, secure and real-time We continue to receive accolades for our industry leadership. In June, HARMAN was named Supplier of the Year at the Automotive Interior Expo in Germany, highlighting our competence in embedded infotainment and telematics solutions. Also, in Consumer Reports, most recent guide to infotainment system, the highest rated system is designed and built by HARMAN as well. 
Now turning to Lifestyle Audio division. Some of our recent notable achievements are highlighted on Slide 8 of the investor presentation. During the quarter, HARMAN won new business awards with Hyundai, Kia, Audi, Lexus, Subaru, in China and Toyota. In addition, we secured our first award for our premium Summit audio platform with an electric vehicle company. This scalable Summit platform provides the foundation to integrate the best of HARMAN's sound processing and sound management technologies along with new features like Connected Jukebox and Virtual Venues to create an unprecedented in-car audio experience. As further proof of HARMAN's leadership in the industry, we won a Ford Excellence award for our audio system in Lincoln vehicles. 
Turning to consumer audio. As I mentioned earlier, we finished a very strong quarter with increasing demand of our award-winning products due to great design and expanded distribution channels. For Lydia, we won a total of 56 design and innovation awards across our consumer audio portfolio. Let me also remind you that we have been selected by Lufthansa to provide our noise cancellation headphones across their fleet. 
Now turning to the Professional Solutions division. In May, we appointed Mohit as the President for the division. Mohit is a seasoned leader with more than 20 years of experience growing audio, video and system business throughout Asia, Middle East and Europe. Mohit brings a new level of energy and sense of urgency to Professional Solutions business. Last year, we implemented our enterprise and entertainment solutions-based go-to-market strategy and we took cost actions in Europe. This year, we are focused on taking additional steps to improve cost structure in North America. We're already seeing encouraging signs of momentum in the enterprise segment. Not only have we booked several significant awards in corporate, government and education markets, we will also launch a number of integrated solutions to support these focused verticals. We expect these actions will help restore Professional to historic levels of growth and profitably. Some of the notable wins and events for the quarter are highlighted on Slide 9 of the investor presentation. 
Now turning to the Connected Services division highlighted on Slide 10, of your presentation. During the quarter, we secured several awards to provide software services for BMW, FCA, Microsoft, BSA and Reliance. In addition, we partnered with NXP Semiconductors to jointly offer new software gateway solutions to the automotive market. We continued to capitalize on our industry-leading cloud-based OTA software update technology, winning awards from leading OEMs, such as FCA, Porsche and Subaru. We now have over $150 million in OTA software auto backlog. And about half of it is in the automotive space covering over a dozen OEMs and growing. 
In summary, this was a year of record across the board at HARMAN. Our success in 2016 demonstrates our team's ability to execute and deliver profitable growth. You would recall, in 2013, we set out an ambitious plan to grow HARMAN revenues to $6 billion by '16. Today, we reported almost $7 billion in revenue and more than doubled our 2013 EBITDA. This morning, we've also provided financial guidance for 2017 and presented a longer-term outlook. Our CFO Sandy Rowland will provide you the details later. 
As we look forward, we see significant growth opportunities across all the divisions. In the automotive space, the industry is experiencing an unprecedented social and technological transformation fueled by increasing intelligent connectivity and supported by autonomous vehicles, and urban mobility. The car is getting an upgrade as never seen before. HARMAN is well-positioned to capitalize on each of these trends. Let me remind you of our portfolio of integrated technologies now include embedded infotainment solutions ranging from display audio to an compute platform addressing entry, mid and high-vehicle classes; enhanced telematics products and gateway resolutions; industry-leading cybersecurity; and OTA products for all ECUs, whether HARMAN supplied or non-HARMAN supplied; superior automotive audio technology like individual sound zones, HALOsonic and Summit; data analytics and back end software services to complement aid our development in the industry. And a number of innovation is still in our pipeline. We have an end-to-end value proposition that automakers are looking for. Building on our strong backlog of awarded business and track record of execution, we expect continued growth in our automotive revenue. At the same time, due to the timing of various automotive program launches and roll-offs, we expect to see lower growth in 2018 followed by strong growth in 2019 and beyond. This is a cycle that is common in our business. We have experienced it before as recently of 2013, as shown on Slide 14 of our presentation. We experienced accelerated growth for several years after the transition year in 2013. In fiscal 2018, we will continue to ramp up new programs and make R&D investments both to deliver on the contracts we have won and to capitalize on the bigger trends we discussed earlier. 
Longer-term, we have confident that we will see accelerated revenue expansion from our automotive backlog, higher-margin automotive services and the increasing market demand for Connected Car and autonomous driving technologies. On top of that, there are additional reasons to be excited. With autonomous driving, the in-car audio experience or sound management becomes even more essential. With our record $6.6 billion of car audio backlog and continued growth in take rates, we expect car audio continue to lead the company in profitability and grow faster than the company average. In addition, we have confident in the turnaround of our professional business. With all the action we have taken, we're optimistic that we can return margins to historical levels over the medium term. Together with the continued growth in our consumer audio business and increasing opportunities in Connected Services, we are squarely on the path towards achieving our goal of $11 billion in revenue by 2021. 
Now I will turn the call over to Sandy, who will give you additional color on our financial results.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Dinesh, and good morning, everyone. Let me walk you through our financial highlights for the quarter and provide additional detail on our outlook for fiscal year 2017 and beyond. As a reminder, most of my financial remarks are provided on an op
componenttext:
Thank you, Dinesh, and good morning, everyone. Let me walk you through our financial highlights for the quarter and provide additional detail on our outlook for fiscal year 2017 and beyond. As a reminder, most of my financial remarks are provided on an operational basis, which excludes acquisition-related items, restructuring and nonrecurring charges. The full reconciliation of our GAAP to our operational results is included in the press release that we issued this morning. This quarter, our revenues were $1.9 billion, an increase of 12% compared to the prior year. Revenue in our Connected Car division increased 11% versus the prior year, primarily due to higher take rates and stronger production. Revenue in our Lifestyle Audio division increased 25% compared to the prior year. The increase in net sales was primarily due to higher take rates and the acquisition of Bang & Olufsen automotive in car audio and higher consumer audio sales driven by continued strong demand for smart audio solutions. Revenue in our Professional Solutions division increased 1% compared to the prior year. Revenue in our Connected Services division increased 7% to $185 million in the quarter compared to $173 million a year ago, primarily due to higher demand for engineering services. Total company gross margin increased 110 basis points to 30.5% primacy to do due to the impact of higher sales volume, leveraging a more efficient fixed production cost based and productivity initiative. Connected Car growth margin increased 300 basis points to 25.5% and Lifestyle Audio gross margin increased 380 basis points to 35.1%, both benefiting from better leverage of fixed cost, lower warranty expenses and manufacturing productivity. Professional Solutions gross margin decreased 340 basis points to 36.7%, driven by product mix and new factory startup cost in Hungary. 
In Connected Services, the timing of booked revenue is tied to specific milestone and longer-term engineering projects, while expenses are recognized as incurred. This can result in margin volatility. As a result, for the fourth quarter, Connected Services growth margin declined 850 basis points to 28.2%. Beginning in fiscal 2017, we used percentage of accounting for significant new contracts. This is expected to reduce some of the volatility. 
Our SG&A expenses as a percentage of net sales increased 20 basis points from the prior year to 20.7%. Connected Car SG&A increased a 110 basis points to 14.1% and Lifestyle Audio SG&A increased 20 basis points to 20.2%, both due to do higher research and development cost to support awarded business. 
SG&A expense in Professional Solutions remained in line with our prior year. Connected Services SG&A as a percentage of sales decreased 180 basis points to 18.2% due to better leverage on higher sales. Finally, corporate SG&A as a percentage of sales declined by 10 basis points to 2.3%. Putting it all together, our consolidated operating income was $185 million compared to $115 million in the prior year, a 24% increase. But all the line, we had higher income tax expenses in the quarter due to an increase in U.S. tax from deemed income on foreign earnings and jurisdictional mix resulting in higher than forecasted effective tax rate. EPS was $1.57 compared to a $1.37 in the prior year, up 14%. 
Now turning to the full year and fiscal year 2016 revenue, EBITDA and EPS, all reached record highs for HARMAN. Revenue was $6.9 billion, an increase of 16% excluding foreign exchange. And EBITDA reached $836 million, a 23% increase excluding foreign exchange, and we grew EPS from $5.71 to $6.24, a 13% increase excluding foreign exchange. 
Now let me spend a few minutes on cash and capital allocation. In fiscal 2016, we generated nearly $450 million of cash flow from operations driven by strong earnings and affective working capital management and we invested approximately $200 million in capital expenditures. In the fiscal year, we repurchased approximately 1.6 million shares at a cost of $140 million. Combined with $100 million in dividend, we returned a record $240 million to our shareholders over half of our cash generated from operations. We ended the fiscal year with $602 million in cash. Across the board, this wraps up a solid fiscal year for HARMAN. 
Now let's turn to our guidance for fiscal 2017. First, we are making a slight adjustment to our divisional reporting structure. We will move our aftermarket car audio business from the Connected Services division to the lifestyle audio division as this product line shares our consumers go-to-market organization and the consumer product innovation center in China. 
Slide 16 shows the impact is approximately $60 million in revenue on the full year basis. 
As Dinesh indicated, we are targeting between $7.3 million and $7.5 billion in revenue for fiscal 2017 and between $900 million and $940 million in EBITDA. Our forecast is based on a number of keys namely global GDP growth of approximately 2.5%, global automotive production growth between 2% and 3%, global industry embedded infotainment take rates increasing from about 27% to 30%, and a euro to dollar exchange rate of 1.10. We expect top line growth and EBITDA expansion across all four division. Furthermore, we expect about $180 million in depreciation and amortization expenses, between $50 million and $60 million in interest expense and charges and we estimate that our tax rate will be between 27.5% and 28% and we have assumed a similar level of share repurchase as fiscal 2016. Assuming approximately 72 million shares outstanding, our EPS will be between $6.75 and $7. We will remain opportunistic in buying back our shares incrementally to our current plan. We have approximately $360 million remaining on our board authorized shares repurchase program, which runs until October 2017. This morning we also provided a longer-term outlook. Our regarding the macroeconomic and automotive production environment are similar to our 2017 guidance assumption. We are targeting a high single-digit revenue CAGR over the next 3 years approximately $8.6 billion in revenue by fiscal 2019. In addition, we expect to grow our EBITDA margins to about 13.5% in fiscal '19, representing a 140 basis point improvement compared to fiscal year 2016. As Dinesh pointed out, we do expect to lower revenue growth in fiscal 2018 due to the timing of various automotive program launches and loss. In subsequent years, we will have a number of new programs reaching full-scale, positioning us for accelerated growth. 
In summary, we are pleased with our fiscal 2016 performance, we have set robust target for fiscal 2017 and the next 3 years and we are focus on innovation and execution to deliver against these target. Thank you for your attention. Dinesh and I are now happy to take your questions.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016

componenttext: It looks like you're expecting as Sandy mentioned, an acceleration in 2019 versus 2018. I'm just curious, what is primarily driving that, whether it might relate to a potential single or large contract on the Connected Car side or really just a clutch on smaller factors? And then while you're coming to maybe just update us on the most material launches you have coming in Connected Car and relative timing of those contracts, for example, General Motors, Subaru, the low end infotainment award that was discussed previous, et cetera?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Ryan, thank you for your question. Yes, first of all, we're very happy with 2016 record revenue and EBITDA and EPS. And with the great backlog we have, especially I repeat, $11 billion order bookings in the last 2 years, that gives us momentum. So we're v
componenttext: Ryan, thank you for your question. Yes, first of all, we're very happy with 2016 record revenue and EBITDA and EPS. And with the great backlog we have, especially I repeat, $11 billion order bookings in the last 2 years, that gives us momentum. So we're very confident about out years. As we dedicated 2018 outlook is a slower growth, and in fact, flattish Connected Car revenue. And that is primarily due to rolling off of some of the programs while we're still ramping up the last programs about in Europe and North America. But they will not fully at scale. So that's what is reflected in '19 and 2021, double-digit growth, and we have number of North American and even Asian programs coming up, which also have very good margins. So we feel very good about '19, '21. Also '18 is actually a very good year. We are still growing and we are still expanding our margins. Let me also mention one highlight, which is reflected in our guidance and has impacted '18 slower growth. As you all know, that in North America, we have a great customer in FCA, Automotive, and we still supply to them as last part of infotainment comes from HARMAN. In fact, we are the primary supplier of audio. And in fact in June, the consumer reports even named it as a top infotainment, what is using from HARMAN. Having said that, there are multiple suppliers of infotainment to FCA, which I have said in my earlier call. Based on FCAs current sourcing strategy, our infotainment volume in fiscal '18 may be lower. And it is reflected in our 2018 guidance and beyond. As you are aware, we have won a couple of follow-on awards as well as over update awards with them for across the car line globally. On top of that, we are also continuing to ship audio and infotainment. And with that said, our strong relationship with FCA, we're well-positioned for the next-generation infotainment program, which we expect to be available for bidding in next 12 to 18 months.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Great. And then my next and last question is on the impact if any that you see to HARMAN from the potential litigious of Fiat Chrysler business by Samsung Electronics. I don't think there is much overlap between your 2 business currently, but there
componenttext: Okay. Great. And then my next and last question is on the impact if any that you see to HARMAN from the potential litigious of Fiat Chrysler business by Samsung Electronics. I don't think there is much overlap between your 2 business currently, but there has been some speculation that Samsung could perhaps be interested in using some sort of launchpad to get into automotive infotainment. So what you can say about the barriers to entry on the embedded side or what competitive advantages that you have that you think you keep newer entrants at bay on the embedded side? And then if were to get into more connected audio sort of our Apple extent to that which is not necessarily a competitive threat?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Ryan, it's a great question. And actually we should clarify. The is a large Tier 1 and very small player in infotainment. In fact, similar to another smaller sort of player in North America, which was up for the sale, which people have has also tried to s
componenttext: Ryan, it's a great question. And actually we should clarify. The is a large Tier 1 and very small player in infotainment. In fact, similar to another smaller sort of player in North America, which was up for the sale, which people have has also tried to sell their infotainment business over the last several years. And we have worked with them often on, but they really make a viable player as is. And especially when you think about how fast the space is changing, it's not about traditional instrument plus thorough infotainment or basic amplification and the speakers, it has moved on to a full connectivity, intelligence, over-the-air update, cybersecurity, scalable end-to-end service platform. It's all about analytics, which will partner with the companies like Mobileye. I think the sensors information and create information. So it's a scale, it's the technology, it's the R&D power. So we will see what that means if that acquisition happens. But we see almost no impact on our current or in our near to midterm future.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016

componenttext: First off, thanks for the so much detail on the longer-term growth and margin provide. I have two questions. One on the long-term outlook and maybe one on the outlook for next year. First on the longer-term margin outlook. Could you give us some color on why -- it looks like your guiding to about 30 basis points of margin improvement in '17, '18, and then we have close to 80 basis points of a step-up in '19. Is that purely function of the leverage of the growth or is there something else going on, maybe there's a good amount of launch cost that are constraining the '18 margins. Just any color you can give on that trajectory, will be helpful?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Thank you for your question. I think you pretty much hit it on spot on. If you look at what we've guided from the margin perspective, we are calling for margin expansion from '17 to '18. But its more muted because the growth is lower between '17 and
componenttext: Yes. Thank you for your question. I think you pretty much hit it on spot on. If you look at what we've guided from the margin perspective, we are calling for margin expansion from '17 to '18. But its more muted because the growth is lower between '17 and '18. But then when you look at our projections between '18 and '19, we really start growing again on the top line. And as you look out across our entire portfolio, we get very strong leverage on top line growth. So that's the primary reason.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: And on the maybe near-term outlook. So it looks like your guidance is slight revenue growth in the professional services business next year. First off, what gives you confidence in that? And second, is there a good amount of accelerating growth in this pr
componenttext: And on the maybe near-term outlook. So it looks like your guidance is slight revenue growth in the professional services business next year. First off, what gives you confidence in that? And second, is there a good amount of accelerating growth in this projections for '18 and '19 in that professional services business?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Great question. So let's start with Professional Solutions business, then I talk about Connected Services. So first of all, this is a good business. We have a built a robust portfolio of audio, video, lighting and automation, and we have expanded our cust
componenttext: Great question. So let's start with Professional Solutions business, then I talk about Connected Services. So first of all, this is a good business. We have a built a robust portfolio of audio, video, lighting and automation, and we have expanded our customer segment to corporate, government and education beyond traditional recording studios and sound. This does has a four-pronged turnaround strategy, which I feel very comfortable with. The number 1 starts with leadership, sense of urgency. We have fixed that. #2, we're addressing that channels. Channels, we're going some market direct, some we're going indirect, but we're training the channels to sell the solutions to enterprise and entertainment segment. And the third is, cross leadership. You know us in HARMAN, we are really paranoid about cost every year, and automotive is a good training ground. So we already took some very strong actions last year. We shut down 2 factories in Europe in high cost and we moved into a brand-new factory in Hungary. And that we already saved over 100 basis point to bottom line improvement, which is already starting to happen. So we will have that this year. It will improve. And then, of course, we have whole slew of new integrated products being launched this year, which absolutely are going to fix the segment strategy for our corporate, government, education and entertainment enterprise. So with that said, 130 basis point improvement in fiscal '17 is a very reasonable, and 3% top line growth, this is after we already the business in Q4, we feel very comfortable. Now moving on to connector services business. That business actually, if you peel the onion and just take what we acquired in is actually grew almost 14% and actually had margins EBITDA also around 14%, 15%. What we did last year, we had 2 features added to that business. One was our aftermarket car audio, which actually really belong to consumer audio. If you take that out, this business moves up to nearly 13%, actually nearly 14% EBITDA, which we have already shown in our slide deck. On top of that, we also acquired last year a company called Redbend, and that company is a great technology and we've business but is in development mode, and we took about $12 million to $15 million bottom line hit for that. So if you adjust for that, our service business actually performed exactly to our deal turns and our expectation nearly 15%. So expecting 15% margins in '17 and expecting 8% growth is very reasonable target. In midterm, I expect this business to grow at double-digit and also perform mid-to high teens bottom line.

componenttext: So Chris, first of all, we are very constrained in terms of naming our customers and timing of their of SOPs. I made a mistake in the process, I will not do it again. What you just said about the customer, program is going quite well and we start in '17 with a very small SOP peak, which we're happy about. And '18 would continue to ramp, but the full scale will achieve in '19, fiscal '19, and that's why we have shown '19 with double-digit growth. And in addition to this program, we have some of the Japanese and other North American and European programs also coming at fully ramped up scale. So that would create scale, which means a lot to the bottom line and the scale also helps us advertise R&D at a larger scale of customers.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then just a little bit on '18, around the division, I mean, if growth is going to be lower on the infotainment, you talked about some of the timing, can you talk about where some of the growth will come in, for example, in Connected Car, not Con
componenttext: Okay. And then just a little bit on '18, around the division, I mean, if growth is going to be lower on the infotainment, you talked about some of the timing, can you talk about where some of the growth will come in, for example, in Connected Car, not Connected Car -- on the services side, do we start to see a pickup in that division in '18?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: So, a great question. As we see almost flattish Connected Car or maybe a slower growth, we will continue to see excellent development in car audio, which is our profit leader in the company and will remain, because we had excellent $6.6 billion double-dig
componenttext: So, a great question. As we see almost flattish Connected Car or maybe a slower growth, we will continue to see excellent development in car audio, which is our profit leader in the company and will remain, because we had excellent $6.6 billion double-digit, reaching 20%-or-so range profitability. And there we see good improvement in take rate. So that will continue to drive. Then we also expect, as we already have 14% EBITDA in our Connected Services business with Redbend not making losses hopefully in '17, we will be close to 0, breakeven point. That would bring us nearly 15% EBITDA in Connected Services. So it's a reasonable to expect in '18 another 100 basis point improvement in the bottom line. Then the third business is professional. This year we feel pretty good about 3% top line and hitting margin improvement of almost 13.7% or nearly 14%. That business should also reach it's historic levels of mid-teens and EBITDA. So all 3 businesses performing quite well and the fourth one also performing very well the Connected Car, only thing is it will not have the same scale effect, although the same profitability, same good leverage and continue to invest in our R&D on the new programs, which will be ramping up fully in end of '18 and beginning of '19. So all in all, '18 would be a very busy year, very good year, building up for excellent accelerated growth in '19 and onwards.

componenttext: First one, just look at incremental margin assumptions for Connected Car in 2017. It's look like a little bit slowdown from the last couple of years in the 42% range, I think for FY '16, but now going to be in the mid-to high teens level at '17. What's providing that somewhat of a drag or step down if you will in incremental margins from '16 to '17?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Thanks for your question. I think, first of all, you have to put in this in prospective. If you look at the margin expansion that we have enjoyed in our Connected Car division over the past 3 years, it's really been fantastic. To take us over 14% EBI
componenttext: Yes. Thanks for your question. I think, first of all, you have to put in this in prospective. If you look at the margin expansion that we have enjoyed in our Connected Car division over the past 3 years, it's really been fantastic. To take us over 14% EBITDA rate this year, 1 year ahead of schedule, we're really pleased about it. So next year we will see continued margin expansion in Connected Car. And the leverage, while it's just a little bit south of 20%, we do have a lot of new awards in our backlog. So R&D will continue to expand. But net-net we're very pleased on the margin department in Connected Car.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: And David, if I may, look, this business as industry is also transforming significantly. And it's a matter of few more years before you will see lot more software content and value differently. At the moment, we are in a unique position. As a company, we
componenttext: And David, if I may, look, this business as industry is also transforming significantly. And it's a matter of few more years before you will see lot more software content and value differently. At the moment, we are in a unique position. As a company, we take 4% to 5% of annual price reduction hit every year. And that's not the case with major other Tier 1s. However, we are slowly changing that dynamics as more and more software solution we're selling, whether its car audio related software or Connected Car solutions software or even Connected Services by itself. We took a very large software services business recently with a European OEM, which we're very proud about. So I think as you start to see that and you will start to see the OTA revenue start to come. And OTA 75% to 80% margin. So we will start to see some improvement in the out years. But even then, in the next -- immediate in few years, we still see margin expansion coming in. We are very happy with it.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016

componenttext: Okay. That's very helpful. And then secondly for me, on the Lifestyle Audio segment. It looks like a very strong quarter from the top line. What specifically, was driving that? Was there any incremental launch activity on the branded car audio side? Was that more on the consumer audio side? And should be seeing something similar carrying forward in terms of quarterly cadence in the first half of 2017 or is that 9% good for full year?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: Right. So this is a great business, great division. Lifestyle has 2 businesses. Almost same equal billion dollar each of our fleet. Our car audio business is our profit king in the company. And there we have nearly $6.6 billion, going into $7 billion auto
componenttext: Right. So this is a great business, great division. Lifestyle has 2 businesses. Almost same equal billion dollar each of our fleet. Our car audio business is our profit king in the company. And there we have nearly $6.6 billion, going into $7 billion auto backup. And here entry to -- barrier to entry is very high, once you are in, you really in with the kind of technology. So there we continue to see our take rates improvement happen. Margin improvement will continue to help EPS accretive. And then second business is almost a billion dollars also, which is a great scale for consumer audio. Now consumer audio, we have created our own niche. We have smart audio. And smart audio means all wireless, all intelligent, all cloud-based speakers and home audio headphones. And that business has evolved very well. As a matter of fact, just lst month, our JBL portable speaker ranked #1 in Europe by research company GFK. And China has started to show great development in terms of their appetite for American branded consumer audio products. So all in all, it did quite well. Q4 came in very strong. Now reminding you as we go forward, with a $1 billion base in consumer audio, we can grow. If you want 20% a year or we can choose where we want to grow to protect the margin. And I would go for the protecting margins. We are reaching close to 10% now in our consumer audio and almost 20% in car audio. So for blended it's 15%. I want to push more margin-driven growth. That's why our gross targets we've given are very balanced.

componenttext: Good. Brian, first of all, thanks for your question. Typically, we have 100% of revenue in the backlog for the immediate 12 months year. So fiscal '17, we have 100% revenue in our backlog. And 3 years out, which is '19, we have about 75% of the revenue in the backlog. And typically 5 years out, we will have 50% in the backlog, which makes a lot of sense. And that's what gives us good visibility and, of course, we will be booking more orders towards 2021 and subsequently.

componenttext: Okay. Second question, you touched upon your assumptions embedded -- embedded infotainment, but you also mentioned the growth Display Audio. If develops where take rates are upper end Display Audio improve at the expense of say mid-level infotainment with embedded apps because I get do that, so Display Audio optional now coming through Apple CarPlay gets you pretty close to mid-level infotainment embedded app. And just how you're positioned for that trend? What do you have in each category? And what kind of assumptions are you making kind the OEM kind of showroom mix around those products in 2018, 2019?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: So Brian, first of all lets go back to our picture, which we have been sharing with you, pie. And if you divide the pie into half, the bottom half of the pie basically traditional AM/MF radio or really nothing. Just a hole. And the top off of the pie, you
componenttext: So Brian, first of all lets go back to our picture, which we have been sharing with you, pie. And if you divide the pie into half, the bottom half of the pie basically traditional AM/MF radio or really nothing. Just a hole. And the top off of the pie, you divide into 2 quadrant. The left quadrant, we have traditionally said, it is the embedded navigation infotainment, and other quadrant is the display audio. So what we're witnessing and we already saw similar development last year. The bottom half of the pie is transforming either into display audio or into embedded infotainment. My personal thesis is, based on lot of discussions with OEM. If we all believe that we're going towards autonomous or driving, cars cannot be run from devices in your hand or in the pocket. Then you will need to have a strong compute platform in the car, sensors, technology and various other things in it. Therefore, even display audio is a intermediate step to go towards fully embedded system. So in the near-term or midterm, 5, 7 years, display audio will actually almost come from the nothing AM/FM and so will embedded infotainment, or 60%, 65% embedded infotainment in 4 to 5 years is pretty much everybody's take right now. So we would actually benefit and enjoy both set type size of the pie growing. But we are into display audio. We are also into entry system, mid systems and the high systems. So we will grow both. While at the same time, you mentioned CarPlay. We're actually implementing CarPlay. We're implementing drive Google AutoLink. We are also implementing CarLife and few other things. So these are all smart apps we will implement on all the systems as we go forward.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016

componenttext: Well, what if those and are those implemented on embedded infotainment as well?

componenttextpreview: As well. Absolutely right. So it's the choices OEMs want to offer, that look you buy a car and you may have 4 members in the family, and if you think about shared economy, you cannot design a car just for CarPlay or just for or just for Google. So we will
componenttext: As well. Absolutely right. So it's the choices OEMs want to offer, that look you buy a car and you may have 4 members in the family, and if you think about shared economy, you cannot design a car just for CarPlay or just for or just for Google. So we will implement all kind of smart apps. So you have a choice, whatever you want to bring it. In fact, I will not name the customer but we are developing a very large program right now, which is designed for 4 different types of phone to operate at the same time, which is going to be first in the industry. Never been done before.

I mean, A, before we get to trend or not, but maybe talk first, assuming it might be a trend, what would be the impact on your revenues and margins be that it's since And then in reverse order, then B, what do you think of the trend or not -- or if not being a trend.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q4 2016 Earnings Call, Aug 04, 2016
componenttextpreview: So Brian, back to what I knowledge the pie. So that is basically the which means it will be from AM/FM or nothing in the car to Display Audio, where you have optionally to either from that or bring your NAV, which we actually support. Which is an business
componenttext: So Brian, back to what I knowledge the pie. So that is basically the which means it will be from AM/FM or nothing in the car to Display Audio, where you have optionally to either from that or bring your NAV, which we actually support. Which is an business for us because we have traditionally been in fully embedded NAV and everything else. And we still do that. In addition, we are doing display audio. We have almost a billion dollar award from an North American customer for display audio And we have other awards from Asia and others. So I think that is definitely going to be the case for the next few years. But lets not forget, in addition, there's a whole lot more going in these car. So the display audio might be a system architecture but there still has lot of software, so they are looking for over-the-air technology. They are looking for other sense of fusion. They are looking for telematics. So telematics is another new area where the new ground is being broken with a gateway approach, which is where we just won a major award with a German automaker. And that's also going to be playing out both in Display Audio segment as well as fully embedded NAV segment. So market is expanding.
