headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Ladies and gentlemen, thank you for standing by, and welcome to the HARMAN Fiscal 2017 First Quarter Earnings Conference Call. [Operator Instructions] As a reminder, this conference is being recorded Thursday, November 3, 2016. I would now like to turn
componenttext:
Ladies and gentlemen, thank you for standing by, and welcome to the HARMAN Fiscal 2017 First Quarter Earnings Conference Call. [Operator Instructions] As a reminder, this conference is being recorded Thursday, November 3, 2016. 
I would now like to turn the conference over to Yijing Brentano, VP of Investor Relations. Please go ahead, ma'am.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thanks, Jennifer. Good morning, and thank you for joining our first quarter fiscal year 2017 investor call. I'm joined in Stamford today by Dinesh Paliwal, our Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer; and by Sandy Rowland, our Chief Financial Offi
componenttext:
Thanks, Jennifer. Good morning, and thank you for joining our first quarter fiscal year 2017 investor call. I'm joined in Stamford today by Dinesh Paliwal, our Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer; and by Sandy Rowland, our Chief Financial Officer. 
If you haven't done so already, I invite you to visit the Investors section of our website, where you can download copies of our earnings release and the supporting slide presentation that we will be referencing today.
Before Dinesh and Sandy provide their remarks on the quarter, let me remind you that certain statements during this conference call and question-and-answer session may be forward-looking in nature as defined in the United States Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. These forward-looking statements are based on management's beliefs, assumptions and current expectations, but are subject to a number of important risk factors and uncertainties, which we have been fully described in the press release that we issued this morning. 
Also, I would like to announce that on the evening of Wednesday, January 4, 2017, we will be hosting technology demonstrations at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas. We will e-mail further details and post additional information on the Investors section of our website. Many of you attended this event in previous years. For those of you who have not attended in the past, this is an excellent opportunity to better understand our connected technologies and experience some of our solutions firsthand. 
Now let me turn the call over to Dinesh.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Yijing, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. I'm pleased to report that our fiscal year is off to a very good start, the solid results for the first quarter. Net sales increased 8% to $1.8 billion. We expanded our operating margins and deliv
componenttext:
Thank you, Yijing, and good morning, ladies and gentlemen. I'm pleased to report that our fiscal year is off to a very good start, the solid results for the first quarter. Net sales increased 8% to $1.8 billion. We expanded our operating margins and delivered a 15% year-over-year improvement in EBITDA. This puts our EBITDA margin at a company record of 12.9%, and we achieved 27% year-over-year improvement in earnings per share. 
I'm particularly pleased with the strong results in our Lifestyle Audio division, which posted 19% year-over-year revenue growth and 50% EBITDA growth. Our unmatched brand portfolio and product innovations are paying off. We're gaining market share against competition for our award-winning consumer audio products, and we're building a lot of momentum and increasing take rates for our car audio and sound management solutions. 
I'm very excited to report that we have been successful in keeping up the momentum in new automotive business wins. During the quarter, we secured over $2 billion of awards, complementing our year-end $24 billion auto backlog. 
In the automotive business, we're witnessing a very interesting trend. HARMAN is not only supplying a compute platform with cutting-edge technology, but also a full suite of car audio and sound management solutions. As you all know, we are the market leader in both of these areas, and we're the only company that can deliver this integrated offering. With our innovation, we have been displacing several competitors over the last few years. As we continue to gain market share, the gap between HARMAN and its competitors has been widening at a faster pace. We have broken this down for you on Page 6 of the slide deck. 
If you release -- if you quickly look at slide deck, you will see since the first quarter of fiscal 2015, we have recognized over $9 billion in automotive revenues. During the same period, we booked over $13 billion of new awards. This means our awards are growing faster than our revenue, and our book-to-bill ratio is 1.4:1. 
In our most profitable business, that is car audio and sound management, the awards grew even faster, with a book-to-bill ratio of 2:1. 
Let me talk a little more about our recent wins in the car audio and sound management business. Following the successful launch of the Revel brand in Lincoln vehicles, I'm pleased to announce the expansion of our business with Ford, another long-term partnership we will supply B&O PLAY-branded car audio systems to Ford's vehicles, cross-car line globally. 
In the Connected Car division, we had wins across geographies and vehicle categories, including autos for high-end, fully embedded compute platforms to entry-level display audio systems, covering wide spectrum of offerings. We are seeing growing demand from our customers for expanded portfolio of connected car solutions, including telematics, cybersecurity, over-the-air updates and advanced safety features. We continue to integrate third-party ADAS offerings while at the same time, developing proprietary solutions such as ADAS, object detection, vision algorithms and surround view software solutions, to name a few. 
In Connected Services, we achieved a new milestone for our over-the-air update software business. As we speak, more than 1 million vehicles on the road are using HARMAN OTA, and this number is growing rapidly. Automakers' response for this offering has been overwhelmingly positive. Not only have we already secured awards from over a dozen OEMs across 3 continents, half of these awards were secured through other Tier 1s. This demonstrates how our OTA solution is on its way to become the industry standard. These wins are strong evidence that automakers and consumers continue to demand an enhanced in-car experience. We are addressing this trend and winning in the marketplace with a unique portfolio of solutions across Connected Car, Lifestyle Audio and Connected Services. 
Before I talk about divisions in more details, let me briefly discuss our rapid growth in China, which I'm extremely proud of. You may recall in 2009, our revenue in China was less than $50 million. Last year, our revenue reached $800 million. That is 50% cumulative annual growth over the last 7 years. This quarter, we grew our revenue in China over 40%, and we have more than $4 billion of automotive order backlog. Needless to say, we have been taking market share left and right in China from our competition. We're growing our automotive business through imports and with the Chinese OEMs as well. We have a very strong foundation in China, with more than 3,000 people and growing to -- and growing. We have 2 world-class manufacturing plants, multiple state-of-the-art research and development centers, engineering and design centers. China is an important long-term growth market. We are winning in automotive, and our iconic brands are boosting our consumer and professional growth. 
Now let me take a closer look at our divisions and review some recent notable achievements. Let's start with our Connected Car division, which is highlighted on Slide 7 of our investor presentation. During the quarter, we secured new and follow-on awards to provide connected car solutions for customers, including Audi, Geely, Maruti Suzuki in India, Mercedes-Benz, Porsche and heavy-truck manufacturer, MAN of Volkswagen Group. During the quarter, we launched embedded infotainment solutions in Land Rover, Audi, Toyota, Porsche and Skoda vehicles. We also began delivering embedded infotainment solutions to the commercial truck market, launching solutions in Volkswagen Group's MAN and Scania trucks. MAN's infotainment system, developed by HARMAN, includes expanded telematics features like digital radio, hands-free telephony and truck-specific navigations. The HARMAN system for Scania includes innovations such as dual mobile phone connectivity, real-time navigation and cloud-based connectivity to fleet management systems. I'm particularly excited about this potential of growth for HARMAN solutions in the commercial fee space. This is a growing market and provides us with an enormous growth opportunity globally unlike any other Tier 1. 
Building on our momentum in winning telematics business, we entered a strategic partnership with AT&T to support the telematics ecosystem. HARMAN's telematics control unit was selected by AT&T for its Mobile Broadband Accelerator program. This pre-certified solution enables rapid deployment of our offering in the industry. 
We continue to receive accolades for our industry-leading innovation, winning a CTIA wireless award for our pupil-based monitoring software and Best in Category awards from Germany's Connect Magazine for our Connected Car systems. HARMAN was the first company to develop a comprehensive cybersecurity framework for automakers. 
We doubled down on research and development investments and acquisitions in the space over the last 2 years. We are setting the industry standard in cybersecurity. And ladies and gentlemen, there will be no autonomous car without the protection of cybersecurity. You have heard me say that many times. Validating our leadership, I'm very proud to share with you first time these following extensive third-party evaluations conducted by NHTSA and the University of Michigan, HARMAN's suite of intrusion detection and mitigation technologies was rated best in class. That is incredible news for the whole industry. 
Now turning to the Lifestyle Audio division, some of our recent notable achievements are highlighted on Slide 8 of the investor presentation. Audio and sound management are essential parts of the connected car experience, and our award-winning car audio solutions continue to resonate with drivers, leading to another strong quarter of double-digit growth in the car audio business. OEMs are recognizing the growing importance of audio and sound management solutions, both in current vehicle design as well as a critical part of the in-car experience in semi-autonomous and fully autonomous vehicles. This trend is validated by our recent wins and our growing audio backlog. I already mentioned the Ford expansion. On top of that, we secured additional awards with Lincoln, Maserati of FCA Group and Toyota. 
During the quarter, we launched car audio solutions in Toyota, Lexus and Alfa Romeo vehicles. And HALOsonic and advanced transducer audio solutions in the Mercedes-AMG E-Class vehicles. 
And now turning to consumer audio. We grew double digits in the quarter due to strong demand for connected and personalized smart audio products. We continue to take market share. In fact, the most recent data from future source confirms HARMAN added over 300 basis points in market share from early 2015 to summer of 2016. This signals that demand for our award-winning products is growing and our design, technology, brands and distribution strategies are working. 
And we are not stopping here. We continue to bring new award-winning products to the market. At the IFA conference in Berlin last September, we launched 33 new products, including a new wireless headphone lineup, a new waterproof portable speaker series. This fall, we also launched JBL-Under Armour co-branded wireless heart rate monitoring headphones. This was the second product introduced as part of the strategic partnership. Most recently, we announced the JBL Playlist audio speaker featuring Google Cast technology. It connects via WiFi and streams directly from the cloud to the speaker, without requiring Bluetooth pairing. This obviously simplifies the user experience while dramatically improving the audio quality. 
Now turning to the Professional Solutions division, highlighted on Slide 9 of the investor presentation. Over the last couple quarters, we have been implementing a series of strategic initiatives. On the cost side, we have completed our European consolidation into Hungary, and we are currently executing additional footprint actions in the U.S. On the top line, we have committed to leveraging the strength of our portfolio to better serve our enterprise and entertainment customers through solutions tailored for focused vertical markets. As an example, HARMAN and IBM announced an exciting strategic partnership last week at the World of Watson conference to bring together HARMAN's end-to-end solution with IBM Watson's cognitive computing capability. Together, HARMAN and IBM will integrate artificial intelligence and smart connectivity, enabling IoT in HARMAN's audio, video and lighting products. We have a successful pilot running at Thomas Jefferson Hospital in Philadelphia that allows patients to use voice commands to alter the temperature in the room, turn off the lights or even ask whether their test results have come in yet. The voice-activated assistant can address many of their nonmedical needs, freeing up medical professionals when they're needed most. Additional applications for HARMAN and IBM Watson extend to hotel, conference room, education. But you can also imagine the possibilities throughout the enterprise and entertainment markets. It's very exciting. Transformational projects like this are exactly why we reorganized our Professional Solutions division. 
Turning specifically to the quarter, HARMAN's entertainment and enterprise solutions were selected by eBay Corporation, Dubai Parks and Resorts, London Business School and the U.S. presidential inauguration to be held in January. As a matter of fact, we're starting to see some nice order pickup, which will convert into revenue in the coming quarters. 
Some notable installations during the quarter include the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., Sky Harbor Airport in Phoenix and the U.S. Naval Command Center in San Diego. HARMAN solutions also powered a wide range of high-profile special events, including the Tony Award-winning musical Hamilton, G20 gala in China as well as world tours for the bands like Metallica and Coldplay. Yes, hard rock bands, Metallica and Coldplay. We remain confident in our strategy for the Professional Solutions division. Our integrated vertical market strategy is gaining traction, and we are focused on new product innovation and cost leadership. We expect to return to growth on a sustainable basis starting next quarter. 
Now turning to the Connected Services division, highlighted on Slide 10 of the investor presentation. During the quarter, we secured awards to provide software services for Honeywell, Intel and Microsoft, among others. We continue to win business with our cloud-based over-the-air software update solutions, including awards from Daimler and LG Electronics. In addition, HARMAN received recognition for its software engineering services capabilities from Cisco and market advisory firm, Zinnov. 
In summary, we are off to a solid start to deliver on our fiscal 2017 targets. We achieved record EBITDA and record earnings per share in the quarter, added over $2 billion of new automotive and software services award and continued to execute on our backlog successfully. We remain focused on innovation, execution and driving cost leadership, which have become hallmark of this company's success. And that is applying to all our businesses. 
Now I will turn the call over to our Chief Financial Officer, Sandy Rowland, who will give you additional color on our financial results for the quarter.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Dinesh, and good morning, everyone. Let me walk you through our financial highlights for the quarter. As a reminder, most of my financial remarks are provided on an operational basis, which excludes acquisition-related items, restructuring and
componenttext:
Thank you, Dinesh, and good morning, everyone. Let me walk you through our financial highlights for the quarter. As a reminder, most of my financial remarks are provided on an operational basis, which excludes acquisition-related items, restructuring and nonrecurring charges. The full reconciliation of our GAAP to our operational results is included in the press release that we issued this morning. 
This quarter, our revenues were $1.8 billion, an increase of 8% compared to the prior year. Revenue in our Connected Car division increased 6% versus the prior year, primarily due to higher take rates and stronger production. Revenue in our Lifestyle Audio division increased 19% compared to the prior year. The increase in net sales was primarily due to higher consumer audio sales, driven by continued strong demand for smart audio solutions and higher take rates in car audio. Revenue in our Connected Services division increased 4% compared to a year ago, primarily due to higher demand for automotive services, while revenue in our Professional Solutions division decreased 3% compared to the prior year. 
Total company gross margin increased 80 basis points to 30.8%, primarily due to the impact of higher sales volume, leveraging a more efficient fixed production cost base and productivity initiatives. Connected Car gross margin increased 110 basis points to 24.8%, benefiting from better leverage of fixed costs and manufacturing productivity. Lifestyle Audio gross margin increased 290 basis points to 35.4%, primarily due to margin expansion in car audio as a result of operating leverage and manufacturing excellence. Professional Solutions gross margin decreased 240 basis points to 39.2%, driven by product mix. 
We are seeing manufacturing cost savings from our footprint migration initiatives. However, as we continue to focus on bringing down our inventory levels in this division, we have lower fixed cost absorption, impacting gross margin in the near term. 
Connected Services gross margin declined 280 basis points to 31.1%, primarily due to higher revenue recognition of high-margin engineering change orders in the prior year. 
We have started to use percentage of completion accounting for significant new contracts, which is expected to reduce some of the volatility. 
Our SG&A expense as a percentage of net sales decreased 20 basis points from the prior year to 20.1%. Connected Car SG&A increased 60 basis points to 12.6% to support growth in awarded business. 
While R&D expense in car audio increased to support our expanding backlog, Lifestyle Audio SG&A decreased 70 basis points to 20.2% due to better leverage on higher sales. SG&A expense in Professional Solutions increased 20 basis points compared to the prior year. Connected Services SG&A expense decreased 200 basis points to 19.3% as a result of footprint migration initiatives related to the integration of Redbend. Finally, corporate SG&A as a percentage of net sales increased by 10 basis points to 2.1%. 
Putting it all together, our consolidated operating income was $187 million compared to $158 million in the prior year, a 19% increase. Below the line, we had an effective tax rate of 25.2%, which is lower than our guidance of 27.5% to 28% for the full year. Our guidance takes into account potential tax law changes that we are actively monitoring. And at this time, we are maintaining our tax rate guidance. Finally, EPS was $1.87 compared to $1.48 in the prior year, up 27%. 
Let me spend a few minutes on cash and capital allocation. We generated $36 million of free cash flow, which we define as cash flow from operations less CapEx, an improvement of approximately $185 million, driven by strong earnings and effective working capital management. 
During the quarter, we were active buyers of our stock. We repurchased approximately 450,000 shares in the quarter at a cost of $35 million. We now have approximately $325 million remaining on our board-authorized share repurchase program, and we will continue to be opportunistic buyers of our stock. 
We are pleased to be off to a good start in fiscal year 2017. We are on track to deliver on our full year guidance, and we look forward to speaking to you about our business at upcoming investor conferences and seeing you in January at our CES technology event. 
Thank you for your attention. Dinesh and I are now happy to take your questions.

componenttext: Sure, David. As you know, we have been investing heavily in software solutions in the division across both business units, whether it's the consumer audio or car audio. Our business is really changing quite a bit. It used to be a pure product business. Now we're supplying software solutions. And in fact, interestingly, before I give you a little breakdown, Connected Services team has really been teaming up with our Lifestyle division to bring in necessary software competence to change consumer products to cloud-based smart speakers, smart devices. Same thing we are doing in car audio. So back to your question, we have roughly -- this division is split pretty much equally in both, but we saw very good development of our consumer business -- consumer audio business grew nearly 25%, and our car audio business grew 15-plus percent in this quarter, which we're extremely pleased with.

componenttext: Got you. Can you give us a little bit more color on premium audio demand in China given -- it seems like it's a burgeoning market take rates on both the consumer and the automotive side seems to be a really low compare to the developed markets. And also, on the order book, the $2 billion that you posted in Q1, a little bit more detail between audio and infotainment would be very helpful.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. So first of all, backlog is sort of split equally, 50-50, almost $1 billion so in infotainment, another $1 billion came from car audio, which we're very pleased with because our car audio business is our profit leader. When it comes to the prolifera
componenttext: Sure. So first of all, backlog is sort of split equally, 50-50, almost $1 billion so in infotainment, another $1 billion came from car audio, which we're very pleased with because our car audio business is our profit leader. When it comes to the proliferation of car audio take rates, yes, of course, China, starting points are very low, low single-digit penetration if you look at whole China. So there, of course, the Chinese consumers, or I would say Asian consumers are very brand hungry. They want American iconic brands to be in their car, and our car company customers continue to find overwhelmingly market research that branded car audio is helping them differentiate their own cars. Having said that, we're actually seeing the penetration of car audio across the world. I mentioned to you we expanded our relationship with Ford, which is a fantastic news. It's a very good business with Ford. Now we replaced a competitor at the high-end Lincoln. We also replaced a competitor for cross-car line globally for Ford worldwide, with both brands coming from HARMAN. In addition, we won business with other German and Asian automakers for car audio. And you saw that I was extremely pleased to share with you our order backlogs for car audio the book-and-bill has gone 2:1 ratio, which means our future is even better. Margins in our backlogs are getting better every quarter, every year.

componenttextpreview: And just quickly, can you size the win with Ford on the B&O? And any kind of commentary on your infotainment system? Obviously, we have one of your competitors that are launching a new, as they call state-of-the-art infotainment system, and I think in the
componenttext: And just quickly, can you size the win with Ford on the B&O? And any kind of commentary on your infotainment system? Obviously, we have one of your competitors that are launching a new, as they call state-of-the-art infotainment system, and I think in the first quarter, and they're going to show that at CES. Any idea of how your best infotainment matches up with their new product that they're going to launch?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. First, thank you, David. First of all, our infotainment award is fairly new. That is a competitive replacement. By the time it goes into car production, I think we are sometime away, probably 18 to 24 months away. So you will see that. And this is fo
componenttext: Yes. First, thank you, David. First of all, our infotainment award is fairly new. That is a competitive replacement. By the time it goes into car production, I think we are sometime away, probably 18 to 24 months away. So you will see that. And this is for Display Audio. That's a brand-new category, which HARMAN is growing into. When it comes to car audio win, that's actually a very sizable win for us, one of the largest wins we have ever seen. But there seem to be a trend. We are seeing that cross-car line, this is almost like a single source solution for car audio whenever car companies are deciding, and stickiness is very high in that business. So all in all, very good. And you will also see from us in CES some incredible product launches across compute platform, across telematics, cybersecurity, ADAS solutions and of course, you will see some sound management and cutting-edge technologies.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Want to talk a couple strategic questions. The first is around kind of the take rates embedded there, but I keep coming back to that. Second maybe just think about that new project invoice in general. So on the first question, Chrysler, which we do know i
componenttext: Want to talk a couple strategic questions. The first is around kind of the take rates embedded there, but I keep coming back to that. Second maybe just think about that new project invoice in general. So on the first question, Chrysler, which we do know is parts of which are going away. But interesting what they're doing in the market is offering the big-screen you connect, as we understand it, as with or without embedded nav, which could take away some of what we -- well, the question is that I can see the consumer appeal there for younger people who don't believe in embedded nav and believe in their smartphones, especially as now Google lets you preload your local maps, reducing data usage. But as you think about what they've done, do you see that spreading to other OEMs? And then also, is that good news for HARMAN in terms of maybe increasing the take rates at the high end by taking away that objection of I don't need embedded nav? Or bad news because even if that happens, there's loss of markup on the nav?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good, Brian. Let me sort of bring it all together. So first of all, what's happening, as you have heard before that if you look at the whole pie, the whole market, so nearly 50% of the business, the bottom half of the pie has been nothing or simple AM/FM
componenttext: Good, Brian. Let me sort of bring it all together. So first of all, what's happening, as you have heard before that if you look at the whole pie, the whole market, so nearly 50% of the business, the bottom half of the pie has been nothing or simple AM/FM radio. The top half of the pie was split equally 25-25 into fully embedded, navigation-based infotainment system and another one was display audio, which means, to put simply -- simply put, it's full embedded system minus navigation. So you can bring your own kind of a thing. What we are witnessing, the bottom half of the pie is very fast moving into both quarters of the top 5, which means either going towards display audio or going into embedded audio. My firm belief, supported by big OEMs worldwide, is that you will see fast migration at equal pace. But very soon, in a couple years, you will see even display audio consumers will start to migrate towards fully embedded. Because it's not clear that if cars are going to be autonomous or semi-autonomous, you can't run them from a handheld device. This is a post-device era we are talking about. The very distributed strong compute platform, which HARMAN is leader in, will actually be part of the car embedded system, the cloud applications. So that's what we are seeing, and we are happy that we're playing on both sides of display audio as well as embedded audio and winning in both sides. Then you also know what else is happening is OTA. The over-the-air update technology is something which is just emerging, and we have the unique patented technology with 15 years of R&D. And we have one more than a dozen OEMs, including FCA, every single cross-car line FCA received an order for our systems as well as non-HARMAN systems to be updated by our OTA technology. And as far as the large screen, Brian, that seemed to be sort of personal choice, and more and more people are asking for it. Therefore, display unit is becoming a very important part. The user interface, the contextual and the smart user interface, their display devices, display units will play a bigger role. Consolidation of industry here is even likely to happen more because nearly 1/3 of COG, cost of goods sold, is getting to close to display unit. We are supplying large display units. As you mentioned, Uconnect, that is a HARMAN system, has been. It won actually in 2016 Best Infotainment System award by Consumer Report. And we are seeing similarly in our Mercedes S-Class BMW 7 Series, Audi A8, those cars we're also seeing large screen. And I guess, Asian consumers will definitely offer large screen. So I think that seemed to be the trend.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: But in terms of the take rate in sort of your CPV, if a customer -- end customer were to come in a showroom and leave with a Uconnect system without embedded nav, does that affect the revenue or EBITDA you would be booking?
componenttext: But in terms of the take rate in sort of your CPV, if a customer -- end customer were to come in a showroom and leave with a Uconnect system without embedded nav, does that affect the revenue or EBITDA you would be booking?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: So interesting you raised that. Let me clarify one more point. Whether you win display audio or full embedded system, the only difference is navigation, which is a component of multiple parts come together to create compute platform. So we're providing ch
componenttext: So interesting you raised that. Let me clarify one more point. Whether you win display audio or full embedded system, the only difference is navigation, which is a component of multiple parts come together to create compute platform. So we're providing choices of using any nav, whether you use 3D high-definition maps, which we supply to our customers or you can use a simple 2D Google Maps or what have you. So choices are there available to you. But imagine, it's still the whole multimedia, the tuner technology, the hands-free telephony, the interface with other ECUs in the car, that still has to be done even for display audio. And that's what our system for Ford is all about, highly integrated display audio, large screen, but you still would have the choice. And eventually, the system can also integrate onboard navigation. Or you can bring it your own. And we are gaining ground as far as the penetration of the take rates. Traditionally, we had seen about 300 basis point year-over-year improvement in take rate, whether it's display audio or fully embedded. We're playing on both and we're seeing same take rate improvement. In fact, slightly more for us because we are working with the customers where the take rates are higher. So I think runway for HARMAN for take rate is pretty strong with nearly $24 billion, $25 billion of order backlog. I think we have perhaps the fastest opportunity to grow this business in the next 5 to 10 years.

componenttext: Yes. Thanks, Ryan. I think that the good and positive margin expansion that we see in Lifestyle is sustainable. Where we saw the greatest margin expansion this quarter was in our car audio division. And I think a lot of it comes from some of the synergies we got from the Bang & Olufsen acquisition. Last year, when we acquired them, we moved their manufacturing out from Denmark into our manufacturing operation in Hungary. And now that those operations are running together, we're getting very good synergies there. But if I look at the margin levels, they were right about the same place that they were in Q4. So quarter sequentially for car audio, we've seen the same pattern for the past 6 months.

componenttext: And also, Ryan, remember the scale is becoming even bigger for us. So margins are sustainable. I would even feel good about our sustainability of top line. We're feeling good about what we have in the pipeline.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016

componenttext: Just a follow-up on Ryan's question about the seasonality. So I'm assuming some of this consumer Lifestyle strength is likely driven by, you guys talked about in the past, some of the upgrade cycles, so I'm assuming iPhone 7 may be drove some of the strength in this quarter. I'm just kind of reinforcing your confidence about the holiday season. So do you think is the second half growth going to be a good deal lower in that business the way you're thinking about it right now?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: So the way you should see that business year-over-year, there is a clear seasonality. Second quarter is the strongest quarter in this business. The first quarter this year, we actually were very pleased with incredible growth, 25%. And we expect Q2 to be
componenttext: So the way you should see that business year-over-year, there is a clear seasonality. Second quarter is the strongest quarter in this business. The first quarter this year, we actually were very pleased with incredible growth, 25%. And we expect Q2 to be similar or even better. Second half is slightly weaker because you have the seasonality. But we think our strength is not just coming because of what you just mentioned with the company, but we are seeing incredible penetration of smart portables. We actually became #1 supplier in the world by GfK, a market tracking agency, in smart portable wireless speakers, and we are seeing similar growth now in our smart headphones. Some of the headphones are even now updated over-the-air with the firmware, software, so the incredible technology we're bringing. So Under Armour is a third piece. As an example, the strategic partnerships like Under Armour in consumer audio or IBM Watson in professional audio will continue to bring more momentum. So Under Armour is a great brand. We're developing jointly products. The product which we just launched called in-ear heart rate monitoring. And let me stress that. This is one of a kind product. It's a military-grade heart rate monitoring, absolutely accurate. So this is designed for athletes, but priced for mass market. So we expect it to also take off very nicely. And you will see some incredible product launches at IFA -- I mean, at CES in January in Las Vegas. So we feel good about this division to continue the great momentum we have.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: That's very helpful. And just on the Connected Car division, the growth there was just slightly lower than the full year target, I think, implies. Is there going to be any lumpiness of that growth this year that we should be thinking about as we kind of g
componenttext: That's very helpful. And just on the Connected Car division, the growth there was just slightly lower than the full year target, I think, implies. Is there going to be any lumpiness of that growth this year that we should be thinking about as we kind of go through the year? Or do you expect it kind of to steadily move more toward that kind of 7-ish percent growth you're targeting?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. So first of all, we are actually evaluating what we guided the market. We guided between 6% to 8%, and we are right in there. And when it comes to cyclicity, typically, our second and fourth quarters are the strongest quarters. Having said that, we'r
componenttext: Yes. So first of all, we are actually evaluating what we guided the market. We guided between 6% to 8%, and we are right in there. And when it comes to cyclicity, typically, our second and fourth quarters are the strongest quarters. Having said that, we're very pleased that Q1 came in where it came in. And what excites me most is the margin expansion continuation. You might have noticed that we are very margin-driven management. We will not negotiate anything but for margins. And for last 3 years, in Connected Car alone, we have added 500 basis points of margin improvement, and Q1 is another strong indication of where we're headed. So all in all, we expect to hit our full year guidance for this division and very good margin development.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Joe Vruwink for David. You talked about being on track to hit full year guidance, but then there's comments like pro turning around, Lifestyle margin staying strong, being on track within Connected Car. So it seems like you're tracking above where
componenttext: This is Joe Vruwink for David. You talked about being on track to hit full year guidance, but then there's comments like pro turning around, Lifestyle margin staying strong, being on track within Connected Car. So it seems like you're tracking above where guidance stands as things sit today. Is there a mitigating factor in the equation we need to consider?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Joe, first of all, a great question. Let me start with this. We're very pleased with our Q1 development. It gives us strong confidence to hit our full year guidance we have provided you in August. Listen, it's still early in the year for us to review to e
componenttext: Joe, first of all, a great question. Let me start with this. We're very pleased with our Q1 development. It gives us strong confidence to hit our full year guidance we have provided you in August. Listen, it's still early in the year for us to review to even increase the guidance. If we were to do that, we need one more quarter. Right now, if I can be honest with you, I feel good about the high end of our guidance where we are tracking. So that's all I can share. I think all 4 divisions are developing well. Professional division, you heard me say that Q2 should be a growth quarter for us. And then from there on, we should see sustainable growth development. So we feel good about in Connected Services. You also mentioned, for Connected Service, typically, our Q4 is the most strongest quarter. But we still came in 6% growth in constant currency, and we guided 8% for the full year. So for all 4 divisions, we feel good about. But all in all, for company, we could be in a better place after Q1.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. Great. And then a few questions on your backlog. Sorry, if I missed it. Can you say how much is newer conquest of the $2 billion and in new awards versus replacement? And then the 25% step-up in your award activity relative to today's connected car
componenttext: Okay. Great. And then a few questions on your backlog. Sorry, if I missed it. Can you say how much is newer conquest of the $2 billion and in new awards versus replacement? And then the 25% step-up in your award activity relative to today's connected car revenue base. If I think about 25%, that's probably a 3-year future value, if you will, thinking about the timing of when those will launch. If I do a compound growth rate on that, that's maybe a high single-digit rate of growth. Is that the right rate of growth to think about for your infotainment business?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: So Joe, let me take the first part of your question. You asked about what part of the new awards that we announced in the quarter were new and which ones were competitive replacements. So if you break it down, if you look at our car audio awards, obviousl
componenttext: So Joe, let me take the first part of your question. You asked about what part of the new awards that we announced in the quarter were new and which ones were competitive replacements. So if you break it down, if you look at our car audio awards, obviously, the Ford award that we announced is a pure competitive replacement. And if you look at the close to $1 billion of new awards in Connected Car, it's split about 50-50.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: 50% competitive replacement and 50% in new awards. I don't know how -- when you say the growth, I mean, the way we like you to see, we're running about 1.25, 1.3 book and bill, which means our orders are ahead of revenue by a factor of -- multiplied to 1.
componenttext: 50% competitive replacement and 50% in new awards. I don't know how -- when you say the growth, I mean, the way we like you to see, we're running about 1.25, 1.3 book and bill, which means our orders are ahead of revenue by a factor of -- multiplied to 1.3 for infotainment, connected car, compute platform. And for car audio, book and bill is 2:1. That means the orders are outpacing revenue by a factor of 2. So all in all, we are running our automotive business, the book and bill is 1.4:1. So that gives us tremendous confidence for the next several years as we guided you for 3-year and 5-year outlook. We feel good about that.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Tavis McCourt with Raymond James.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Tavis McCourt with Raymond James.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: It's Tavis. Two of them, Dinesh. First, I think this will help kind of get around some of the questions earlier. You won quite a bit of display audio in the last several quarters, Toyota, Ford. I think you mentioned at least one of the awards this quarter
componenttext: It's Tavis. Two of them, Dinesh. First, I think this will help kind of get around some of the questions earlier. You won quite a bit of display audio in the last several quarters, Toyota, Ford. I think you mentioned at least one of the awards this quarter was display audio. So based on that knowledge, do you expect any material change in your gross margin or operating margin profile in the Connected Car division as that mix changes towards Display Audio going forward? And then secondly, I wonder if you could discuss a little bit the kind of the sensitivity to the model. If we get a decline in auto production next year given investor concerns right now, maybe a bit of an explanation of how the cost structure's changed since the last recession. If you've done any sensitivity analysis on if you are to get a 5% decline of production, what that would mean for the business and cost structure.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. So great, Tavis, let me answer first question, and maybe Sandy will give more color on the second. But first of all, display audio or embedded audio as a blend, margins continue to improve. As you have heard us say and we have validated, we are very
componenttext: Sure. So great, Tavis, let me answer first question, and maybe Sandy will give more color on the second. But first of all, display audio or embedded audio as a blend, margins continue to improve. As you have heard us say and we have validated, we are very margin-driven management team. We will walk away from business if it does not meet our margin requirements, and we have done it and it won't be the last time. We will do it in the future because there's plenty of business out there. Yes, we are market leader with a 25% of the world market and then rest is sharing 75%, so we win obviously a lot of business, but we also walk away from others. Having said that, Display Audio is a good business. It meets our margin requirements. It's not dilutive, actually, it's accretive, all in all. When it comes to sensitivity to the market production, as we guided for the full '17, 2% to 3%. Actually, that -- the production guidance still holds because we guided China to be around 3%, 3.5%. China is tracking over 6%. We guided Europe to be right around 0% to 1%. Europe came in slightly weaker. U.S. is holding. So all in all, global production for our fiscal year is in line, and we feel good about our full year guidance. Hypothetically, if production becomes flat or even lower than that, I think that's where the cost advantage and the baseline cost comes in. And I'll let Sandy give some color.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, Tavis, just for some sensitivities for your model. I think the way to break it down is if you look at our portfolio of businesses, remember that we have business that's outside of the automotive space. So overall, about 65% of our revenues across con
componenttext: Yes, Tavis, just for some sensitivities for your model. I think the way to break it down is if you look at our portfolio of businesses, remember that we have business that's outside of the automotive space. So overall, about 65% of our revenues across connected car and car audio come from automotive. So it's about 65% of our company's exposure, which is right around $4.7 billion. So each point of production is worth somewhere between $45 million and $50 million to the top line. And if you look at it from a leverage standpoint, we've typically said that we get about 20% operating leverage on the upside. And it works that way on the downside as well, typically between 20% to 25%. And if it stays down longer, we'll take -- continue to take cost actions to mitigate any of the erosion.

componenttext: I was going to say, Brad, that we do guide that the upside leverage is about 20%, but we do tell you that there is some volatility from quarter-to-quarter, and that's partially why we don't give quarterly guidance. From a Connected Car standpoint, we do like to see favorable margins in the first half of the year because you do have the ATR impact hitting us in third quarter, so that's something to keep in mind. But if you look over the past several years, we've been seeing consistent drop-down of around 20%.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Got it. That's super helpful. And then just on the professional business, any kind of updated thoughts there. Historically, I think you've seemed a bit more open the last few quarters to maybe divesting that asset at some point, just given there are fewer
componenttext: Got it. That's super helpful. And then just on the professional business, any kind of updated thoughts there. Historically, I think you've seemed a bit more open the last few quarters to maybe divesting that asset at some point, just given there are fewer cost synergies versus the OEM business. Can you provide any update as to how you're thinking about the recovery and future of that business within the HARMAN portfolio?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: So consistently, what we said in the last couple of quarters, this business is going through some transformation, and we are very vigorously taking strategic actions. 3 areas, the 3 buckets, which I know how to do well in our company, that is cost leaders
componenttext: So consistently, what we said in the last couple of quarters, this business is going through some transformation, and we are very vigorously taking strategic actions. 3 areas, the 3 buckets, which I know how to do well in our company, that is cost leadership, new product introduction and go-to-market strategy. All 3 are totally worked on as the new leader of the division, who brings tremendous sense of urgency. We already consolidated our European footprint, which is flowing through our bottom line, almost 100 basis point improvement in the margins this year, which we confirmed to you last time. This year, we have already announced and we are working on execution of couple U.S. sites, which will also add another 50 to 100 basis point improvement once we are done by end of this year. On top of that, brand-new -- many new products will be launched, and you will see some of them coming out at NAMM, which is North America Professional Audio Society, January 2017. So new products being launched to fulfill the solution needs for enterprise and entertainment. Another great example for that was IBM Watson, the strategic partnership, how we are enabling IoT in professional audio/video, lighting, first time any pure company is doing that's HARMAN. And third go-to-market, sales training for our own people and our channels. Distributors and reps is undergoing very well. We're seeing traction. In fact, the orders we have booked in Q1 are very encouraging to me. And that the way we see it, October sales is already in, so we have overall better visibility. Q2 should be a growth quarter. And from this point on, you should expect growth. And in the end, I will say this business is a great business, has been good business for HARMAN, and we expect this business to return to double-digit margin soon, and then from there on, be a good contributor to the company.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Jacob Hughes on for Joe. Just had a couple of strategic questions. MIT recently put forth their vehicle cybersecurity guidance. Wonder if you had any initial take on that and what are the opportunities for HARMAN. And then secondly, how does QNX a
componenttext: This is Jacob Hughes on for Joe. Just had a couple of strategic questions. MIT recently put forth their vehicle cybersecurity guidance. Wonder if you had any initial take on that and what are the opportunities for HARMAN. And then secondly, how does QNX aiming for a Tier 1 status? And what happens if other software players get involved? How do you think about that?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Wonderful. Let me take the -- I mean, the cybersecurity first then QNX. So cybersecurity, unless you missed my opening comments, I shared with you one of the breaking news that NHTSA together with University of Michigan, conducted a third-party research a
componenttext: Wonderful. Let me take the -- I mean, the cybersecurity first then QNX. So cybersecurity, unless you missed my opening comments, I shared with you one of the breaking news that NHTSA together with University of Michigan, conducted a third-party research and evaluation of available cybersecurity intrusion detection and mitigation solutions, and HARMAN ranked #1, absolutely best in class. And this is extremely encouraging for me personally because we actually double down years ago when no one talked about cybersecurity, we said without cybersecurity, you should not even dream of autonomous or semi-autonomous. As soon as you connect your car, you've got bad guys coming in your car. So we are actually leading that space. And just like we did for QNX, making a standard, we are doing for OTA, Redbend technology, and we think our cybersecurity will become industry standard. So we're very happy about it, and we have number of customers right now in RFQ phase where our cybersecurity would be integral part of their offerings. Turning to QNX. QNX is one of the several operating systems out there. And HARMAN used to own QNX, and we have incredible competence and we used QNX still in some of our systems. Same time, we are also using Linux. We are using Android, and we're using hybrid approaches. So we wanted to be totally agnostic, and we feel very good about. We're developing very large multibillion-dollar programs in Android as well as Linux and QNX.

componenttextpreview: I just had one big-picture question. I was just curious, given the pretty big upside in the quarter versus what we all were thinking, and you guys mentioned market share gains across different channels as well as different product categories. Is there any
componenttext: I just had one big-picture question. I was just curious, given the pretty big upside in the quarter versus what we all were thinking, and you guys mentioned market share gains across different channels as well as different product categories. Is there anything within that you could highlight maybe the top things that drove that -- those share gains, whether it's road map advancements that are picking up steam or channel relationships that are gaining ground. I'm just curious where you'd see the internal momentum during the quarter.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. It's a great question, and it is a strategic question, which I hope gets asked all the time because I think we have clearly broken out from the pack of other Tier 1s. So in Connected Car, what is differentiating HARMAN from rest is we're the only co
componenttext: Sure. It's a great question, and it is a strategic question, which I hope gets asked all the time because I think we have clearly broken out from the pack of other Tier 1s. So in Connected Car, what is differentiating HARMAN from rest is we're the only company who has the most powerful compute platform with wide integration capability of multiple ECUs supplied by various other Tier 1s. And we're the one who worked agnostically with all silicon or memory suppliers whether it's Intel, Samsung, TI, NVIDIA, Qualcomm, NXP. And we create -- we worked with them, designed a unique solution for automotive and then we deploy that. In addition, we are also the company who has broken out in telematics space. We have been doing telematics for multiple generations in Germany and in the United States. Now we have launched very first order industries first, I repeat, gateway-based telematics for a German OEM, which we believe will become another trend. And the third is cybersecurity and ADAS solutions. Cybersecurity had been doubling down and also, OTA, we have clear market lead on that. We have won 14 car companies already, 6 or 7 of them through directly to HARMAN and others through other competitors. And ADAS, you heard me say we integrate some of the best of the best, whether it's coming from Mobileye or from somewhere else. And we also develop our own object detection, vision algorithms and that camera 360s surround view, implementing in Asia as well as the German automakers. So that's our differentiation in connected car. In car audio, our key differentiation is having the access to the world's best brand. That is differentiating the top luxury cars from the other premium cars. And then when it comes to creating next-generation solutions, I mentioned, imagine you're sitting in a shared economy in a car with 3 other passengers you don't know you're sitting with, you will need to have your own individual sound/video zone. That's HARMAN's patented technology. So we are doing road noise cancellation. We are doing ambient noise cancellation. We are doing engine noise cancellation. We are doing individual sound zones. So combine it with unique market-leading iconic brand and sound management system, that put us apart from anybody. And by the way, I repeat, we're the only company who has that power of car audio and sound management and Connected Car. No other Tier 1 can boast that.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, this has been a great, great quarter, and I'd like to thank you all for your continued interest in HARMAN's story. This is my 10th year, and this management team is very stable and take great pride in doing what we do well, that is execution. We don
componenttext:
Well, this has been a great, great quarter, and I'd like to thank you all for your continued interest in HARMAN's story. This is my 10th year, and this management team is very stable and take great pride in doing what we do well, that is execution. We don't worry about strategy every day. We have a great strategy, but we execute well. We take great pride in saying we are margin-expansion company and we take great pride in innovation. 
So with that, I would say to our owners, our shareholders, our investors and our sell-side and buy-side analyst community, thank you for taking our story and supporting our story and very eloquently explaining it to other people who don't quite understand as new customers. And we remain very excited about our story. We are a continued growth story. We have been and that we hope we are off to a very good start in fiscal '17. Thank you all, and we'll be talking and meeting with many of you over the next days or so.
