componenttext: Sure, David. As you know, we have been investing heavily in software solutions in the division across both business units, whether it's the consumer audio or car audio. Our business is really changing quite a bit. It used to be a pure product business. Now we're supplying software solutions. And in fact, interestingly, before I give you a little breakdown, Connected Services team has really been teaming up with our Lifestyle division to bring in necessary software competence to change consumer products to cloud-based smart speakers, smart devices. Same thing we are doing in car audio. So back to your question, we have roughly -- this division is split pretty much equally in both, but we saw very good development of consumer business -- consumer audio business grew nearly 25%, and our car audio business grew 15-plus percent in this quarter, which we're extremely pleased with.

componenttext: Got you. headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. So first of all, backlog is sort of split equally, 50-50, almost $1 billion so in infotainment, another $1 billion came from car audio, which we're very pleased with because our car audio business is our profit leader. When it comes to proliferation
componenttext: Sure. So first of all, backlog is sort of split equally, 50-50, almost $1 billion so in infotainment, another $1 billion came from car audio, which we're very pleased with because our car audio business is our profit leader. When it comes to proliferation of car audio take rates, yes, of course, China, starting points are very low, low single-digit penetration if you look at whole China. So there, of course, the Chinese consumers, or I would say Asian consumers are very brand-hungry. They want American iconic brands to be in their car, and our car company customers continue to find overwhelmingly market research that branded car audio is helping them differentiate their own cars. Having said that, we're actually seeing the penetration of car audio across the world. I mentioned to you we expanded our relationship with Ford, which is a fantastic news. It's a very good business with Ford. Now we replaced a competitor at the high-end Lincoln. We also replaced a competitor for cross car line globally for Ford worldwide, with both brands coming from HARMAN. In addition, we won business with other German and Asian automakers for car audio. And you saw that I was extremely pleased to share with you our order backlog for car audio, the book-and-bill has gone 2:1 ratio, which means our future is even better. Margins in our backlogs are getting better every quarter, every year.

componenttext: And just quickly, can you size the win with Ford on the B&O? And any kind of commentary on your infotainment system? componenttext: Yes. First, thank you, David. First of all, EIN [ph] fotainment award is fairly new. That is a competitive replacement. By the time it goes into car production, I think we are sometime away, probably 18 months to 24 months away. So you will see that. And this is for Display Audio. That's a brand-new category, which HARMAN is growing into. When it comes to car audio win, that's actually a very sizable win for us, one of the largest wins we have ever seen. But this seemed to be a trend. We are seeing that cross car line, this is almost like a single source solution for car audio whenever car companies are deciding, and stickiness is very high in that business. So all in all, very good. And you will also see from us in CES some incredible product launches across compute platform, across telematics, cybersecurity, ADAS solutions and of course, you will see some sound management -- cutting-edge technologies.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Wanted to ask a couple strategic questions. The first is around kind of the take rates in embedded nav; I keep coming back to that. Second maybe just think about that new project in voice in general. So on the first question, Chrysler, which we do know is
componenttext: Wanted to ask a couple strategic questions. The first is around kind of the take rates in embedded nav; I keep coming back to that. Second maybe just think about that new project in voice in general. So on the first question, Chrysler, which we do know is parts of which are -- going away. But interesting what they're doing in the market is offering the big-screen Uconnect, as we understand it, as with or without embedded nav, which could take away some of what we -- well, the question is that I can see the consumer appeal there for younger people who don't believe in embedded nav and believe in their smartphones, especially as now Google lets you preload your local maps, reducing the data usage. But as you think about what they've done, do you see that spreading to other OEMs? And then also, is that good news for HARMAN in terms of maybe increasing the take rates at the high end by taking away that objection of I don't need embedded nav? Or bad news because even if that happens, there's loss of markup on the nav?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good, Brian. Let me sort of bring it all together. So first of all, what's happening, as you have heard before, that if you look at the full pie, the whole market, so nearly 50% of the business, the bottom half of the pie has been nothing or simple AM/FM
componenttext: Good, Brian. Let me sort of bring it all together. So first of all, what's happening, as you have heard before, that if you look at the full pie, the whole market, so nearly 50% of the business, the bottom half of the pie has been nothing or simple AM/FM radio. The top half of the pie was split equally 25-25 into fully embedded, navigation-based infotainment system and another one was display audio, which means, to put simply -- simply put, it's full embedded system minus navigation. So you can bring your own kind of a thing. What we are witnessing, the bottom half of the pie is very fast moving into both quarters of the top pie, which means either going towards display audio or going into embedded audio. My firm belief, supported by big OEMs worldwide, is that you will see fast migration at equal pace. But very soon, in a couple years, you will see even display audio consumers will start to migrate towards fully embedded. Because it's not clear that if cars are going to be autonomous or semi-autonomous, you can't run them from a handheld device. This is a post-device era we are talking about. The very distributed strong compute platform, which HARMAN is leader in, would actually be part of the car embedded system with cloud applications. So that's what we are seeing, and we are happy that we're playing on both sides of display audio as well as embedded audio and winning in both sides. Then you also know what else is happening is OTA. The over-the-air update technology is something which is just emerging, and we have the unique patented technology with 15 years of R&D. And we have won more than a dozen OEMs, including FCA; every single cross-car line FCA received an order for our systems as well as non-HARMAN systems to be updated by our OTA technology. And as far as the large screen, Brian, that seemed to be sort of personal choice, and more and more people are asking for it. Therefore, display unit is becoming a very important part. The user interface, the contextual and the smart user interface, their display devices, display units will play a bigger role. Consolidation of industry here is even likely to happen more because nearly 1/3 of COG, cost of goods sold, is getting to close to display unit. We are supplying large display units. As you mentioned, Uconnect, that is a HARMAN system, has been. It won actually in 2016 Best Infotainment System award by Consumer Report. And we are seeing similarly in our Mercedes S-Class BMW 7 Series, Audi A8, those cars we're also seeing large screen. And I guess, Asian consumers will definitely offer large screen. So I think that seemed to be the trend.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: But in terms of the take rates in sort of your CPV, if a customer -- end customer were to come in a showroom and leave with a Uconnect system without embedded nav, does that affect the revenue or EBIT that you would be booking?
componenttext: But in terms of the take rates in sort of your CPV, if a customer -- end customer were to come in a showroom and leave with a Uconnect system without embedded nav, does that affect the revenue or EBIT that you would be booking?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: So it's interesting you raised that. Let me clarify one more point. Whether you win display audio or full embedded system, the only difference is navigation, which is a component of multiple parts come together to create compute platform. So we're providi
componenttext: So it's interesting you raised that. Let me clarify one more point. Whether you win display audio or full embedded system, the only difference is navigation, which is a component of multiple parts come together to create compute platform. So we're providing choices of using any nav, whether you use 3D high-definition maps, which we supply to our customers or you can use a simple 2D Google Maps or what have you. So choices are there available to you. But imagine, it's still the whole multimedia, the tuner technology, the hands-free telephony, the interface with other ECUs in the car, that still has to be done even for display audio. And that's what our system for Ford is all about, highly integrated display audio, large screen, but you still would have the choice. And eventually, the system can also integrate onboard navigation. Or you can bring it your own. And we are gaining ground -- as far as the penetration of the take rates, traditionally, we had seen about 300 basis point year-over-year improvement in take rate, whether it's a display audio or fully embedded. We're playing on both and we're seeing same take rate improvement. In fact, slightly more for us because we are working with the customers where the take rates are higher. So I think runway for HARMAN for take rate is pretty strong with nearly $24 billion, $25 billion order backlog. I think we have perhaps the fastest opportunity to grow this business in the next 5 years to 10 years.

componenttext: Yes. Thanks, Ryan. I think that the good and positive margin expansion that we see in Lifestyle is sustainable. Last year, when we acquired them, we moved their manufacturing out from Denmark into our manufacturing operation in Hungary. And now that those operations are running together, we're getting very good synergies there. But if I look at the margin levels, they were right about the same place that they were in Q4. So quarter sequentially for car audio, we've seen the same pattern for the past 6 months.

componenttextpreview: So the way you should see that business year-over-year, there is a clear seasonality. Second quarter is the strongest quarter in this business. Well, first quarter this year, we actually were very pleased with incredible growth, 25%. And we expect Q2 to b
componenttext: So the way you should see that business year-over-year, there is a clear seasonality. Second quarter is the strongest quarter in this business. Well, first quarter this year, we actually were very pleased with incredible growth, 25%. And we expect Q2 to be similar or even better. Second half is slightly weaker because you have the seasonality. But we think our strength is not just coming because of what you just mentioned with the company, but we are seeing incredible penetration of smart portables. We actually became #1 supplier in the world by GfK, a market tracking agency, in smart portable wireless speakers, and we are seeing similar growth now in our smart headphones. Some of the headphones are even now updated over-the-air with the firmware, software, so the incredible technology we're bringing. So Under Armour is a third piece. As an example, the strategic partnerships like Under Armour in consumer audio or IBM Watson in professional audio will continue to bring more momentum. So Under Armour is a great brand. We're developing jointly products. The product which we just launched called in-ear heart rate monitoring. And let me stress that. This is one-of-a-kind product. It's a military-grade heart rate monitoring, absolutely accurate. So this is designed for athletes, but priced for mass market. So we expect it to also take off very nicely. And you will see some incredible product launches at IFA -- I mean, at CES in January in Las Vegas. So we feel good about this division to continue the great momentum we have.

componenttext: That's very helpful. And just on the Connected Car division, the growth there was just slightly lower than the full year target, I think, implies. headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. So first of all, we are actually evaluating what we guided the market. We guided between 6% to 8%, and we are right in there. And when it comes to cyclicity, typically, our second and fourth quarters are the strongest quarters. Having said that, we'r
componenttext: Yes. So first of all, we are actually evaluating what we guided the market. We guided between 6% to 8%, and we are right in there. And when it comes to cyclicity, typically, our second and fourth quarters are the strongest quarters. Having said that, we're very pleased that Q1 came in where it came in. And what excites me most is the margin expansion continuation. You might have noticed that we are very margin-driven management. We will not negotiate anything but for margins. And for last 3 years, in Connected Car alone, we have added 500 basis points of margin improvement, and Q1 is another strong indication of where we're headed. So all in all, we expect to hit our full year guidance for this division and very good margin development.

componenttextpreview: Joe, first of all, a great question. Let me start with this. We're very pleased with our Q1 development. It gives us strong confidence to hit our full year guidance we have provided you in August. Listen, it's still early in the year for us to review to e
componenttext: Joe, first of all, a great question. Let me start with this. We're very pleased with our Q1 development. It gives us strong confidence to hit our full year guidance we have provided you in August. Listen, it's still early in the year for us to review to even increase the guidance. If we were to do that, we need one more quarter. Right now, if I can be honest with you, I feel good about the high end of our guidance where we are tracking. So that's all I can share. I think all 4 divisions are developing well. Professional division, you heard me say that Q2 should be a growth quarter for us. And then from there on, we should see sustainable growth development. So we feel good about in Connected Services, you also mentioned. For Connected Service, typically, our Q4 is the most strongest quarter. But we still came in 6% growth in constant currency, and we guided 8% for the full year. So for all 4 divisions, we feel good about. But all in all, for company, we couldn't be in a better place after Q1.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: So Joe, let me take the first part of your question. You asked about what part of the new awards that we announced in the quarter were new and which ones were competitive replacements. So if you break it down, if you look at our car audio awards, obviousl
componenttext: So Joe, let me take the first part of your question. You asked about what part of the new awards that we announced in the quarter were new and which ones were competitive replacements. So if you break it down, if you look at our car audio awards, obviously, the Ford award that we announced is a pure competitive replacement. And if you look at the close to $1 billion of new awards in Connected Car, it's split about 50-50.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: 50% competitive replacement and 50% in new awards. I don't know how -- when you say the growth, I mean, the way we like you to see, we're running about 1.25, 1.3 book and bill, which means our orders are ahead of revenue by a factor of -- multiply to 1.3
componenttext: 50% competitive replacement and 50% in new awards. I don't know how -- when you say the growth, I mean, the way we like you to see, we're running about 1.25, 1.3 book and bill, which means our orders are ahead of revenue by a factor of -- multiply to 1.3 for infotainment, connected car, compute platform. And for car audio, book and bill is 2:1. That means orders are outpacing revenue by a factor of 2. So all in all, we are running our automotive business, the book and bill is 1.4:1. So that gives us tremendous confidence for the next several years as we guided you for 3-year and 5-year outlook. We feel good about that.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Tavis McCourt with Raymond James.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Tavis McCourt with Raymond James.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: It's Tavis. Two of them, Dinesh. First, I think this will help kind of get around some of the questions earlier. You won quite a bit of display audio in the last several quarters: Toyota, Ford, I think you mentioned at least one of the awards this quarter
componenttext: It's Tavis. Two of them, Dinesh. First, I think this will help kind of get around some of the questions earlier. You won quite a bit of display audio in the last several quarters: Toyota, Ford, I think you mentioned at least one of the awards this quarter was display audio. So based on that knowledge, do you expect any material change in your gross margin or operating margin profile in the Connected Car division as that mix changes towards Display Audio going forward? And then secondly, I wonder if you could discuss a little bit the kind of the sensitivity to the model. If we get a decline in auto production next year given investor concerns right now, maybe a bit of an explanation of how the cost structure's changed since the last recession. If you've done any sensitivity analyses on if you were to get a 5% decline of production, what that would mean for the business and cost structure.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. So great, Tavis, let me answer the first question, and maybe Sandy will give more color on the second. But first of all, display audio or embedded audio -- as a blend, our margins continue to improve. As you have heard us say and we have validated,
componenttext: Sure. So great, Tavis, let me answer the first question, and maybe Sandy will give more color on the second. But first of all, display audio or embedded audio -- as a blend, our margins continue to improve. As you have heard us say and we have validated, we are very margin-driven management team. We will walk away from business if it does not meet our margin requirements, and we have done it and it won't be the last time. We will do it in the future because there's plenty of business out there. Yes, we are market leader with 25% of the world market and then rest is sharing 75%, so we win obviously a lot of business, but we also walk away from others. Having said that, Display Audio is a good business. It meets our margin requirements. It's not dilutive, actually, it's accretive, all in all. When it comes to sensitivity to the market production, as we guided for the full '17, 2% to 3%. Actually, that -- the production guidance still holds because we guided China to be around 3%, 3.5%. China is tracking over 6%. We guided Europe to be right around 0% to 1%. Europe came in slightly weaker. U.S. is holding. So all in all, global production for our fiscal year is in line, and we feel good about our full year guidance. Hypothetically, if production becomes flat or even lower than that, I think that's where the cost advantage and the baseline cost comes in. And I'll let Sandy give some color.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, Tavis, just for some sensitivities for your model. I think the way to break it down is if you look at our portfolio of businesses, remember that we have business that's outside of the automotive space. So overall, about 65% of our revenues across con
componenttext: Yes, Tavis, just for some sensitivities for your model. I think the way to break it down is if you look at our portfolio of businesses, remember that we have business that's outside of the automotive space. So overall, about 65% of our revenues across connected car and car audio come from automotive. So it's about 65% of our company exposure, which is right around $4.7 billion. So each point of production is worth somewhere between $45 million and $50 million to the top line. And if you look at it from a leverage standpoint, we've typically said that we get about 20% operating leverage on the upside. And it works that way on the downside as well, typically between 20% to 25%. And if it stays down longer, we'll take -- continue to take cost actions to mitigate any of the erosion.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016

componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Brad Erickson, Pacific Crest Securities.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016

componenttext: First, I know historically, I guess, the margin flow-through on the Connected Car business has been a little bit lumpy, depending on some, I guess, more random timing, of things like R&D, reimbursements, et cetera. Can you help us with just, I guess, the linearity that you're thinking about the margin flow-through as we go through fiscal '17 here in the Connected Car business?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Go ahead, Dinesh.
componenttext: Yes. Go ahead, Dinesh.

componenttext: Go ahead, Sandy.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: I was going to say, Brad, that we do guide that the upside leverage is about 20%, but we do tell you that there is some volatility from quarter-to-quarter, and that's partially why we don't give quarterly guidance. From a Connected Car standpoint, we do l
componenttext: I was going to say, Brad, that we do guide that the upside leverage is about 20%, but we do tell you that there is some volatility from quarter-to-quarter, and that's partially why we don't give quarterly guidance. From a Connected Car standpoint, we do like to see favorable margins in the first half of the year because you do have the APR impact hitting us in third quarter, so that's something to keep in mind. But if you look over the past several years, we've been seeing consistent drop-down of around 20%.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Got it. That's super helpful. And then just on the Professional business, any kind of updated thoughts there. Historically, I think you've seemed a bit more open the last few quarters to maybe divesting that asset at some point, just given there are fewer
componenttext: Got it. That's super helpful. And then just on the Professional business, any kind of updated thoughts there. Historically, I think you've seemed a bit more open the last few quarters to maybe divesting that asset at some point, just given there are fewer cost synergies versus the OEM business. Can you provide any update as to how you're thinking about the recovery and future of that business within the HARMAN portfolio?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: So consistently, what we said in the last couple of quarters, this business is going through some transformation, and we are very vigorously taking strategic actions. 3 areas, the 3 buckets, which I know how to do well in our company, that is cost leaders
componenttext: So consistently, what we said in the last couple of quarters, this business is going through some transformation, and we are very vigorously taking strategic actions. 3 areas, the 3 buckets, which I know how to do well in our company, that is cost leadership, new product introduction and go-to-market strategy. All 3 are totally worked on. There's a new leader of the division, who brings tremendous sense of urgency. We already consolidated our European footprint, which is flowing through our bottom line, almost 100 basis point improvement in the margins this year, which we confirmed to you last time. This year, we have already announced and we are working on execution of couple U.S. sites, which will also add another 50 to 100 basis point improvement once we are done by end of this year. On top of that, brand-new -- many new products will be launched, and you will see some of them coming out at NAMM, which is North America Professional Audio Society, January 2017. So new products being launched to fulfill the solution needs for enterprise and entertainment. Another great example for that was IBM Watson, the strategic partnership, how we are enabling IoT in professional audio/video, lighting, first time any Pro company is doing, that's HARMAN. And third go-to-market, sales training for our own people and our channels, distributors and reps, is undergoing very well. We're seeing traction. In fact, the orders we have booked in Q1 are very encouraging to me. And that the way we see it, October sales is already in, so we have liberal visibility. Q2 should be a growth quarter. And from this point on, you should expect growth. And in the end, I will say this business is a great business, has been good business for HARMAN, and we expect this business to return to double-digit margin soon, and then from there on, be a good contributor to the company.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016

componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Joseph Spak with RBC Capital Markets.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Jacob Hughes on for Joe. Just had a couple of strategic questions. MIT recently put forth their vehicle cybersecurity guidance. Wonder if you had any initial take on that and what are the opportunities for HARMAN. And then secondly, how does QNX a
componenttext: This is Jacob Hughes on for Joe. Just had a couple of strategic questions. MIT recently put forth their vehicle cybersecurity guidance. Wonder if you had any initial take on that and what are the opportunities for HARMAN. And then secondly, how does QNX aiming for a Tier 1 status? And what happens if other software players get involved? How do you think about that?

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Wonderful. Let me take the -- I mean, the cybersecurity first then QNX. So cybersecurity, unless you missed my opening comments, I shared with you one of the breaking news that NHTSA together with University of Michigan, conducted a third-party research a
componenttext: Wonderful. Let me take the -- I mean, the cybersecurity first then QNX. So cybersecurity, unless you missed my opening comments, I shared with you one of the breaking news that NHTSA together with University of Michigan, conducted a third-party research and evaluation of available cybersecurity intrusion detection and mitigation solutions, and HARMAN ranked #1, absolutely best in class. And this is extremely encouraging for me personally because we actually double down years ago when no one talked about cybersecurity, we said without cybersecurity, you should not even dream of autonomous or semi-autonomous. As soon as you connect your car, you've got bad guys coming in your car. So we are actually leading that space. And just like we did for QNX, making a standard, we are doing for OTA, Redbend technology, and we think our cybersecurity will become industry standard. So we're very happy about it, and we have number of customers right now in RFQ phase where our cybersecurity would be integral part of their offerings. Turning to QNX. QNX is one of the several operating systems out there. And HARMAN used to own QNX, and we have incredible competence and we use QNX still in some of our systems. Same time, we are also using Linux. We are using Android, and we're using hybrid approaches. So we wanted to be totally agnostic, and we feel very good about. We're developing very large multibillion-dollar programs in Android as well as Linux and QNX.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Stephen Fox with Cross Research.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Stephen Fox with Cross Research.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: I just had one big-picture question. I was just curious, given the pretty big upside in the quarter versus what we all were thinking, and you guys mentioned market share gains across different channels as well as different product categories. Is there any
componenttext: I just had one big-picture question. I was just curious, given the pretty big upside in the quarter versus what we all were thinking, and you guys mentioned market share gains across different channels as well as different product categories. Is there anything within that you could highlight maybe the top things that drove that -- those share gains, whether it's road map advancements that are picking up steam or channel relationships that are gaining ground. I'm just curious where you'd see the internal momentum during the quarter.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. It's a great question, and it is a strategic question, which I hope gets asked all the time because I think we have clearly broken out from the pack of other Tier 1s. So in Connected Car, what is differentiating HARMAN from rest is we're the only co
componenttext: Sure. It's a great question, and it is a strategic question, which I hope gets asked all the time because I think we have clearly broken out from the pack of other Tier 1s. So in Connected Car, what is differentiating HARMAN from rest is we're the only company who has the most powerful compute platform with wide integration capability of multiple ECUs supplied by various other Tier 1s. And we're the one who work agnostically with all silicon or memory suppliers whether it's Intel, Samsung, TI, NVIDIA, Qualcomm, NXP. And we create -- we work with them, design the unique solution for automotive and then we deploy that. In addition, we are also the company who has broken out in telematics space. We have been doing telematics for multiple generations in Germany and in the United States. Now we have launched very first order -- industry's first, I repeat, gateway-based telematics for a German OEM, which we believe will become another trend. And the third is cybersecurity and ADAS solutions. Cybersecurity we're doubling down and also, OTA, we have clear market lead on that. We have won 14 car companies already, 6 or 7 of them through directly to HARMAN and others through other competitors. And ADAS, you heard me say we integrate some of the best of the best, whether it's coming from Mobileye or from somewhere else. And we also develop our own object detection, vision algorithms and the camera 360s surround view, implementing in Asia as well as the German automakers. So that's our differentiation in connected car. In car audio, our key differentiation is having the access to the world's best brand. That is differentiating the top luxury cars from the other premium cars. And then when it comes to creating next-generation solutions, I mentioned, imagine you're sitting in a shared economy in a car with 3 other passengers you don't know you're sitting with, you will need to have your own individual sound/video zone. That's HARMAN's patented technology. So we are doing road noise cancellation. We are doing ambient noise cancellation. We are doing engine order [ph]  cancellation. We are doing individual sound zones. So combine it with unique market-leading iconic brand and sound management systems, that put us apart from anybody. And by the way, I repeat, we're the only company who has that power of car audio and sound management and Connected Car. No other Tier 1 can boast that.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, this has been a great, great quarter, and I'd like to thank you all for your continued interest in HARMAN's story. This is my 10th year, and this management team is very stable and take great pride in doing what we do well, that is execution. We don
componenttext:
Well, this has been a great, great quarter, and I'd like to thank you all for your continued interest in HARMAN's story. This is my 10th year, and this management team is very stable and take great pride in doing what we do well, that is execution. We don't worry about strategy every day. We have a great strategy, but we execute well. We take great pride in saying we are margin-expansion company and we take great pride in innovation. 
So with that, I would say to our owners, our shareholders, our investors and our sell-side and buy-side analyst community, thank you for taking our story and supporting our story and very eloquently explaining it to other people who don't quite understand as new customers. And we remain very excited about our story. We are a continued growth story. We have been and we hope we are off to a very good start in fiscal '17. Thank you all, and we'll be talking and meeting with many of you over the next days or so.

headline: Harman International Industries, Incorporated, Q1 2017 Earnings Call, Nov 03, 2016

componenttext: Ladies and gentlemen, this does conclude the conference call for today. We thank you for your participation and ask that you please disconnect your lines. Have a good day, everyone.
